title: 3-roll-2 single breasted blazer (Burgundy blazer with burgundy trim)
description:
Burgundy blazer with tonal grosgrain trim. Handmade in New York. 75% wool, 25% cotton flannel. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets. Burgundy grosgrain trim on edge of blazer and top edge of pockets.
Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. Cross-stitched Latin motto FORSAN ET HAEC under lapel. Rowing Blazers house button in brass, made in Connecticut. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Props not included.
This blazer has a modern cut and runs a little more snugly than most of our other blazers because of the hefty material. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 come in regular or long. Model is 5'11" and wears a 40.
"There is an oft-repeated myth that the blazer has its origins in the jackets worn by the crew of the H.M.S. Blazer in the mid-19th century. But this is a classic case of false etymology. In reality, the blazer was born in the early 1800s, in the rowing clubs of Oxford and Cambridge. There, the blazer served a practical purpose, keeping oarsmen warm during chilly training sessions. Many of these early boating jackets were brightly colored and bound with grosgrain ribbon. It was one of these designs that introduced the word ‘blazer’ into the English vocabulary: the vivid scarlet coats of Lady Margaret Boat Club at St. John’s College, Cambridge, were nicknamed “blazers” on account of their “blazing red” hue. I (re-) discovered the first known use of the word “blazer” in the Wren Library at Cambridge when I was writing my book. I used the reciprocal privileges that came with my Oxford University ID and spent the day tracking down this reference. Its context is a crew list in the 1852 Cambridge University Almanack, which now appears as one of the inner labels of our blazers. The burgundy-on-burgundy is a refined variation on the very first ‘blazer.’" - Jack

title: Super Heavyweight Overshirt by Sports D'Epoque (1860 Skull authentic heavyweight rugby overshirt )
description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) black rugby overshirt with satin-stitch embroidered skull and crossbones. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; seven-button front; gorgeous rib knit cuffs.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
According to legend, the game of rugby originated at Rugby School in England in during a game of soccer (football) in 1823. The story goes that one of the boys, William Webb Ellis, caught the ball and simply ran with it in his arms to the opposing goal. The sport was institutionalized with a firm set of rules for the first time in 1845 under the auspices of the famous Thomas Arnold, then-headmaster of Rugby School, who believed that teamwork and rivalry were paramount. He also instituted the House system at Rugby, with "School House" and "Town" as the two main rugby sides (for boarders and day students) within the school. The School House jersey featured an embroidered skull and bones motif, perhaps in reference to the more violent nature of the school's particular brand of football.

And listen, while we can’t guarantee you’ll be hitting bombs to left field, we can guarantee that these products will have you feeling like you just hit that walk-off. Game on.

title: Distressed cotton blazer (Destroyed "X" Blazer in Navy Cotton Twill)
description:
The destroyed version of our cotton twill blazer, in the style of the jackets worn at the annual Dutch Varsity regatta. This jacket features raw edges at the lapel notch and around the chest pocket, and it is enzyme washed to make it extra soft. It's also machine-washable.
Hand tailored in New York. 3-roll-2 silhouette. 100% cotton. Three patch pockets. Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Machine washable. Cross-stitched Latin proverb ("O Tempora! O Mores!") under lapel. Props not included.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long. Model is 5'11" and wears a 38.
We took our signature blazer fit and construction and rendered it in a rugged navy cotton twill, in the style of the cotton jackets worn at the annual Dutch Varsity regatta - where student rowers famously engage in semi-organized fights, grabbing each other by the lapels and trying to wrestle each other to the ground. Then we subtly destroyed it with raw edges on the lapel notches and around the edge of the chest pocket, and enzyme washed it to give it a soft, lived-in feel. Machine washable.

description: An illustrious past has portrayed the Chelsea boot in various lights along the way. With strong last development, Crockett & Jones is able to produce a selection of Chelsea boots ranging from smart and elegant to casual country styling. Expert pattern cutting, and shoemaking of the highest order, means Crockett & Jones makes some of the finest Chelsea boots on offer today.

title: Shetland wool sweater (Shaggy Dog Sweater - Orange)
description:
100% Shetland wool sweater in orange featuring an oversized version of the vintage Shaggy Dog label on the chest. Made in Scotland. Part of a limited edition Rowing Blazers x J.Press collaboration.
100% Shetland wool. Made in Scotland.
This sweater is made in J.Press' original wide-body 'dad fit'.
Rowing Blazers founder Jack Carlson grew up in Cambridge, Mass., and bought his first Shaggy Dog sweater from J. Press in Harvard Square when he was in high school. “We don’t make sweaters at Rowing Blazers, and the Shaggy Dog is not only a J. Press icon, but it’s a staple of traditional American menswear period,” he said. “I love the vintage label on my old Shaggy Dog sweater, with the little drawing of the dog. It was a natural fit to collaborate and put a tongue-in-cheek spin on the Shaggy Dog sweater.”

title: Super Heavyweight Rugby by Sports D'Epoque (Argentina 1965 authentic heavyweight rugby)
description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) white and light-blue striped rugby jersey with embroidered "puma." Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; three-button placket; gorgeous rib knit cuffs.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
Argentina played its first international rugby match in 1910 against a touring British Isles team, and the light blue and white striped jersey dates back to 1927. It was during their 1965 South Africa tour that the Argentinian rugby team gained its now-official nickname, "The Pumas." A South African journalist mistook the jaguar badge emblazoned on the team's jersey for a puma, and the name stuck. To this day, the Argentinian team is known as The Pumas, and their badge remains the jaguar.

title: The Perfect White Shirt
description:
It was Baron Alexis de Rede who famously stated "I dislike men who do not wear white shirts after six o'clock." Times have changed since the heights of cafe society in Paris, but we still like nothing better than a beautiful crisp white shirt in the evening.
Made from a dense fine twill woven in Bergamo, this is one of those cottons that has enough body to ensure it doesn't crease throughout the day but is also lightweight enough to breathe. The soft fabric stays white and holds its freshness after many washes. It looks amazing with a tie, not too flashy and not to stingy, sitting perfectly under a jacket. Designed for maximum versatility, this shirt also looks effortlessly chic worn open at the neck.
Details and care:- 100% Cotton- Made in Poland- No chest pocket- Cold gentle machine wash, do not dry clean- Do not bleach- Tumble dry on medium- Medium iron- Line dry in shade

The dodo here is richly rendered in perfectly imperfect satin stitches on Japanese wool. Wear it and remember that man manages to ruin absolutely everything." - Jack

title: Corduroy Dad Hat (Luke Edward Hall Tutankhamun Cap)
description:
Pink corduroy dad hat with hand-embroidered Luke Edward Hall Tutankhamun mask.
London-based artist Luke Edward Hall and Rowing Blazers founder Jack Carlson share a love for the Classical world. In Luke’s case, it’s an aesthetic fascination: the architecture of Greco-Roman temples, and the human and divine body in sculpture. For Jack, it’s an academic pursuit: before establishing the New York-based menswear brand in 2017, he was a field archaeologist in Italy and earned a PhD in Roman archaeology at Oxford. The two met in 2014 when Jack’s book – also called Rowing Blazers – was published. But they reconnected when Rowing Blazers launched as a brand, and the idea of a collaboration came naturally to both of them. The capsule is based on a series of five illustrations by Luke Edward Hall inspired by the ancient world: a Greek vase; the mask of Tutankhamun; a discus-thrower; a set of ionic columns in ruin; and a statue bust.
Adjustable. One size fits most

title: Wide-wale Corduroy Jacket (Women's Extra Soft Corduroy Jacket in Dusty Rose)
description:
Hand-tailored jacket in extra soft, wide-wale Italian corduroy. Handmade in New York. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets. Hidden cross-stitched proverb ("O Tempora! O Mores!") under lapel.
Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. House brass buttons. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Props not included.
This blazer is moderately fitted and fits true to size. Model is 6'0" and wears a M. 0-2 should order XS; 4-6 should order S; 8-10 should order M; 12-14 should order L; 16-18 should order XL..
"Corde-du-roi" ("cord of the king") is the mythical origin for the modern word "corduroy." In reality, the material originated as an industrial workwear fabric. We prefer the more regal connotation. And that's why, while most corduroy jackets - even the expensive ones - feel stiff and starchy, ours is super soft. Made from luxurious Italian wide-wale corduroy, our jacket is velvet-y enough to nap in. Hand-tailored in New York City with a Latin proverb (Cicero's "O Tempora! O Mores!") stitched under the lapel, this jacket is fit for a king. It's unlined in the back and perfect for September-March.

title: Super Heavyweight Overshirt by Sports D'Epoque (The Varsity authentic heavyweight rugby overshirt)
description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) navy rugby overshirt with satin-stitch embroidered Jutphaas emblem. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; seven-button front; gorgeous rib knit cuffs.
The annual Varsity Race in the Netherlands is one of the most historic, prestigious rowing events in the world and home to many of the sport’s greatest and most eccentric traditions. These include the naked swim out to the victorious crew; the traditional blazer-fights; and the post-race kroegjool festivities. This year marks the 135th Varsity. To celebrate, Rowing Blazers has made a special capsule collection co-branded with The Varsity using their historic Jutphaas emblem.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.

title: 100% Cotton T-Shirt (John's Pizzeria of Bleecker Street T-Shirt)
description:
100% cotton John's of Bleecker Street t-shirt in black. This is the same shirt worn by the guys behind the counter at the historic John's of Bleecker Street pizzeria in Greenwich Village.
This is a 100% authentic John's of Bleecker tee - approved by John's Pizzeria and the same design that's worn by the guys serving up pies. Founded in 1929 by John Sasso, John's is known for its strict NO SLICES policy, and for having the oldest pizza oven still operating in New York City. John's is probably the most consistent pie in the city, and one of the few institutions in the city still using an authentic coal-fired oven.
Unisex. Runs true to size (men's sizes).

title: Charcoal Sweatshirt with Hand-Embroidered Badge (RB x Merz Thunderbolt Sweatshirt)
description:
Heavyweight (340 g. / 12 oz.) charcoal crewneck sweatshirt with hand-embroidered badge. 100% three-thread pure organic cotton. Made in Germany on vintage loopwheelers and circular knitting machines.
Circular knit: no side seams. Tactile, slightly irregular surface structure. Triangular insert made of rib ware on the front and back of the neckline. Durable waistband made of rib ware on hem and sleeves maximum comfort. Triangular patch under the arms. Gentle to the skin. Free of chemical additives. Eco friendly: no industrial prewash.
Unisex (men's sizing). Runs on the slimmer side. For a relaxed fit, order one size up. Circa 1 inch extra length, as garment will shrink in the first wash.
This limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Merz b. Schwanen draws on both brands' commitment to vintage fabrics and handwork. It combines Merz's pure, minimalist craftsmanship with the cryptic, hand-embroidered graphic motifs from the mind of Rowing Blazers creator Jack Carlson. Made with love in small batches on vintage equipment in the Swabian Alps, this piece is made with sturdy, loopwheeled three-thread organic-cotton and features triangular inserts on the neckline and under the arms for a natural fit and maximum comfort.

This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long. Model is 5'11" and wears a 40.
“The original blazers were the hoodies of their time, because cotton jersey hadn't been invented yet. But when the blazer was born, it was the coolest, most comfortable, most nonchalant garment known to man. We wanted to capture that spirit in the 21st century, while maintaining many of the details and construction techniques that went into the vintage blazers we hold in such esteem. I think we've succeeded, and everyone who tried this blazer on during its development wanted to keep it on all day." - Jack

description:
Handmade in New York. 100% Japanese wool. Single embroidered palms motif.
"Tipsy" Latin address label on back. (Props not included).
One size. 2 7/8 inches wide.
"The finest and oldest Oxford pub (a thirteenth century institution) is The Bear Inn, where the walls and ceiling are covered in swatches of club, academic and regimental neckties. If you go into The Bear wearing a club tie that does not already grace their establishment, you may have a piece of the tie snipped off with scissors in return for a half-pint of beer. The embroidery on some of the vintage ties in The Bear is stunning, and many of their motifs are at once whimsical, cryptic, and captivating. My favorites are those with a single, hand-embroidered motif under the knot; and they serve as the inspiration for this collection of ties. A symbol of abundance and expanse; romance and discovery; warmth and health, the palm appears frequently in the heraldry of tropical realms." - Jack

description:
Cream blazer with top-stitched "swelled seam" edges and pockets. Handmade in New York. Year-round 75% wool 25% cotton. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets.
Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. Cross-stitched Latin motto FORSAN ET HAEC under lapel. Rowing Blazers house button in brass. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Props not included.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long.
"The three-roll-two silhouette, ventless back: these are qualities a proper blazer is supposed to have. Many have forgotten, but we shall remind them! Details like the single cuff buttons; the vitreous enamel buttonhole badge; and the hidden, cross-stitched motto are subtle, crispy and cryptic." - Jack

title: Cotton Jersey Blazer (Red Cotton Blazer with "Swelled Seam" Topstitch)
description:
Red knit cotton jersey blazer with "swelled seam" topstitch. Handmade in New York. 100% American year-round heavyweight cotton jersey. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets.
Hidden rib cuff. Rib underarm gusset. “Henry” label under collar. Rowing Blazers house brass button. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Ventless.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long.
The original blazers were the hoodies of their day (warm-up jackets for Oxford and Cambridge rowers). We wanted to honor that heritage by creating a casual blazer in cotton jersey. We developed this premium American-knit French terry ourselves, and it couldn’t have come out better. But this isn’t a sweatshirt: each one is hand-tailored in the United States with a painstaking attention to detail. The most comfortable blazer a guy or girl can own.

title: Wall Street Duffle Bag (Duke & Duke Banker Bag)
description:
Hand crafted in Connecticut from 18 oz. canvas with a water-resistant finish.
17" long and 10" deep. The straps are emblazoned with the corporate logo of Duke & Duke Commodities Brokers: the fictional firm from the 1983 cult film “Trading Places” with Eddie Murphy, Dan Aykroyd, Jamie Lee Curtis, and Clotilde.
The banker bag - the little navy canvas duffle emblazoned with investment bank logos on its webbed cotton straps - is a New York icon. For some, it’s a badge of honor. For others, it’s a token of unearned privilege. But whether you’ve protested Wall Street bailouts or just passed your Series 7, we can all agree that these little bags are so square that they’re hip. More than that, they’re the perfect size; deceptively simple; convenient and well-built. Isn’t it time there was a banker bag for the masses? Rowing Blazers partnered with Warden Brooks, the mother-daughter owned company that has made the authentic Wall Street Duffle since 1978, to produce a banker bag we can all enjoy. Just like the canvas bags Warden Brooks makes for the like of Goldman, Merrill, and the New York Stock Exchange, this one is hand crafted in Connecticut from 18 oz. canvas with a water-resistant finish.

title: Row New York Extra Large Beach Bag (Brooklyn Heavy Duty Beach Bag - Noah x Rowing Blazers)
description:
Part of a limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Noah, in support of Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. The program serves over 4000 kids from all five boroughs, mostly from the city's under-resourced communities. American-made heavy-duty black canvas tote bag with embroidered Brooklyn borough patch. 100% cotton.
Heavy-duty cotton canvas. Limited edition. Made in the U.S.A.
15% of all sales will go directly to Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. Both Rowing Blazers and Noah are NYC-based brands, and it means a lot to both to be able to partner with a program that has a direct impact on the community in which they create. 100% of kids at Row New York graduate high school and 99% go on to college; 100% exceed the CDC's recommended daily activity levels. Needless to say, these are much higher than city averages. 84% of participants row for free, and 53% come from families with a household income under $30,000. Over half will become first generation college students.

title: Spread Collar Shirt (Contrast Collar Oxford with Busted Seams)
description:

This shirt has a modern cut. Model is 5'11" and wears a Medium.
"The best pieces in menswear are the result of combining seemingly incongruous ideas: high-brow and low-brow, formal and casual. I wanted to take the classic, comfortable Oxford cloth generally used for American button-downs, and make a traditional, proper English spread collar shirt. The busted seams keep it funky and perfectly imperfect." - Jack

title: Lightweight Cotton Pants (Milk-and-Sugar Seersucker Pants)
description:
100% Cotton Seersucker pants in cream and blue. Handmade in New York.
The seersucker that we use in our jackets and trousers is woven just for us: it's a slightly wider stripe than your run-of-the-mill seersucker, and a slightly creamier shade of white.
These pants are straight leg - our slightly more fitted, though by no means tight, cut. Pants are listed by waist size. Waist sizes 28-32 are 32 inches in length. Larger waist sizes are 34 inches in length. Roll 'em up or get 'em trimmed if needed!
We think that seersucker doesn't has to be worn as a full suit with a bowtie (unless that's what you're into!). As usual, we like the history and origins: it's a practical summer cloth for being active. It can be worn with whatever you damn well please. Whether you're riding a sweltering subway car; sitting in the back of your air-conditioned Rolls; or, hell, jogging to your destination, you'll show up looking remarkably... cool.

title: Super Heavyweight Rugby by Sports D'Epoque (Richmond authentic heavyweight rugby)
description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) horizontal-striped rugby jersey. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; three-button placket.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
So far, most of our rugbies have been recreations of really old-school international rugby jerseys; and most of these are solid colors, with oversized, intricate embroidery. But I do also love a good old-fashioned hoop stripe rugby shirt. Of course, to introduce these into our collection, I wasn't going to just pick any old random colors for the stripes. I went to a framed print that hangs next to my desk -- a chart from The Boy's Own Paper 1922 called "Some Famous Rugby Football Jerseys." Two caught my eye in particular, and they happen to be the colors of two of the oldest rugby clubs in the world: Richmond F.C. and Birkenhead Park F.C. Birkenhead Park was founded in 1871, the same year as the Rugby Football Union (the first governing body for "rugby-rules football"). Their red-white-blue-white pattern is so old, but looks so modern. Richmond began as a soccer club, but was one of the founding members of the Rugby Football Union. Their black-red-gold colors were chosen on a whim in the 1860s and inspired by a Belgian army detachment training in London at the time. We're obsessed with the history and the stories behind the clothes, so this is the perfect way for us to introduce hoop-striped rugbies into our collection.

title: 100% Pima Cotton Polo (Authentic Polo Shirt With Satin Stripe - Burgundy)
description:
100% pima cotton real piqué polo jersey with a genuine, hand-sewn diagonal satin stripe. Authentic, but also modern and uncomplicated.
Three-button placket (the good ol' fashioned way). Split tail. No logo on chest, because, come on, you either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing. 100% Peruvian pima cotton. Props not included.
Unisex (men's sizing). Classic / oversized fit. For a more fitted look, order one size down.
"This shirt is based on a vintage Yale polo jersey from the early 80s: it was beautiful. Navy blue soft pima cotton (no tech-y fabrics) with a hand-stitched white satin stripe - not too wide - running diagonally across the front. No one makes polo shirts like these (until now), and there's a reason why: it's not easy, because the pima cotton is a knit, and the satin is a woven. It has to be sewn by hand. But it's worthwhile, because the result is just right. I would never buy a pieced piqué diagonal stripe polo shirt; but this is a different animal altogether. You feel like Laddie Sanford, or like Steve McQueen in the Thomas Crown Affair. But it's also modern and uncomplicated. Our polos don't have any logo on the chest, because I like it that way; I either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing." - Jack

title: Super Heavyweight Rugby by Sports D'Epoque (Blue Skull authentic heavyweight rugby)
description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) blue rugby jersey with satin-stitch embroidered skull and crossbones. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Working button cuffs. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; three-button placket. Working cuff buttons.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
The original rugby shirts were the house jerseys of Rugby School in England; they featured white band collars and plackets, working cuffs, and - in the case of the school’s most dominant rugby side, School House, an oversized satin-stitched skull and crossbones motif. Ours are true to every original detail and made from 14 oz. organic cotton.

description:
Part of a limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Noah, in support of Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. The program serves over 4000 kids from all five boroughs, mostly from the city's under-resourced communities. Gray sweatpants with Queens embroidery on the left leg. 100% cotton.
Limited edition Noah core logo with oars on back; borough embroidery on left leg. Made in Canada.
These sweatpants fit true to size (men's sizing). Unisex.
15% of all sales will go directly to Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. Both Rowing Blazers and Noah are NYC-based brands, and it means a lot to both to be able to partner with a program that has a direct impact on the community in which they create. 100% of kids at Row New York graduate high school and 99% go on to college; 100% exceed the CDC's recommended daily activity levels. Needless to say, these are much higher than city averages. 84% of participants row for free, and 53% come from families with a household income under $30,000. Over half will become first generation college students.

title: Cotton wide leg trousers (Cream Twill Wide Leg Pant)

Rugged cotton-twill. Old school mid-rise. More cream than khaki
These are wide-leg pants. Not as extreme as Oxford bags. But a good full leg, much fuller than your run-of-the-mill skinny-jean chinos. Rise is mid-rise. Pants are listed by waist size. All sizes are 32 inches in length. Roll 'em up or get 'em trimmed if needed!
We’ve wanted to start doing trousers for a long time, but it’s taken many iterations and samples to get exactly right. We’re finally happy, and we think you will be too. Our trousers, just like our jackets, are all hand tailored in New York City. They have a slightly higher rise than your average pair of trousers, which we think is more comfortable and more flattering. They’re a rugged, sturdy cotton twill that can take a beating - but have a dry enough hand that you can wear them year-round.

title: Wind Vintage (Late 1960s Wakmann Complete Calendar Chronograph)
description: This Wakmann chronograph is one of the best-looking complete calendar chronograph watches from the 1960s and one of the more complex watches made in that period. It features a “reverse panda dial” meaning it has a black base with white chronograph registers for measuring time. It also features the month, day of the week, and date. The movement was made by Valjoux, a company that supplied chronograph movements to Rolex for its famous Daytona and “Jean-Claude Killy” complete calendar watches as well as Heuer and its Carrera and Autavia models. The watch is in “like new” condition and truly a spectacular-looking watch with a large 39mm case excluding crown. This watch is currently on view at the Rowing Blazers Clubhouse at 161 Grand Street in New York City. Curated by Wind Vintage. Ships separately. Please allow an additional 7-10 days for delivery. Contact eric@windvintage.com for inquiries.

100% Shetland wool. Made in Scotland.
This sweater is made in J.Press' original wide-body 'dad fit'.
Rowing Blazers founder Jack Carlson grew up in Cambridge, Mass., and bought his first Shaggy Dog sweater from J. Press in Harvard Square when he was in high school. “We don’t make sweaters at Rowing Blazers, and the Shaggy Dog is not only a J. Press icon, but it’s a staple of traditional American menswear period,” he said. “I love the vintage label on my old Shaggy Dog sweater, with the little drawing of the dog. It was a natural fit to collaborate and put a tongue-in-cheek spin on the Shaggy Dog sweater.”

title: Red Wing Heritage Moc Boot In Charcoal Rough & Tough Leather
description:
Red Wing’s Classic Work boots were designed and built to withstand the daily rigors of the work day on the farm and in the factory. The lightweight crepe sole featured a minimal tread design to reduce the mud that would cling to a farmer’s boots but still provide the underfoot comfort the work day required. Red Wing would brand the crepe sole as the Traction Tred sole. These classic boots featured a moc toe design. The name came from the word moccasin, the Algonquian Indian word for shoe. This combination of the u-shaped moc toe leather upper and the white crepe sole would become the iconic boot style for the Red Wing brand. It is one of the oldest Red Wing styles and a best-seller.
Product Details:
- Outsole: Traction Tred- Insole: Leather- Hardware: Nickel Eyelets- Construction: Goodyear Welt- Last: 23- Laces: 48 inch Black Tasman Lace

title: Blue Stripe Oxford Button Down Shirt
description:
We love Oxford button down shirts. They are the perfect shirt for so many occasions. There is no wonder why they have become the go to shirt for some of the world's best dressed men.
So how have we improved on this classic piece?
Well, we started with the cloth. We searched everywhere for an Oxford cloth with body and substance but one that is also soft. An Oxford that ages like a good Oxford should. An Oxford that will be with you through the good times and bad. An Oxford that really becomes part of the family. An Oxford that is not going to moan and complain if it's scrunched up at bottom of your bag. An Oxford that doesn't retaliate and crease-up like its more delicate contemporaries. It's an Oxford that understands that you're busy and is just happy to be involved. It's a resilient little Oxford. An Oxford that is made like Oxford cloth used to be made. It's everything you are looking for in an Oxford and more importantly everything you need from a friend.
Next we made a few tweaks to the basic design. The classic button down collar has been usurped by an elegant one piece construction. The pocket is slightly larger than usual and set a touch lower so the shirt has a more relaxed image. The stitching is finer and set at a tighter spacing, and the cut is a little slimmer than your classic American boxy button down.
Order now as this could be the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
Details and Care:- 100% cotton- Made in Poland- Cold gentle machine wash, warm iron, do not bleach

title: 100% Cotton T-shirt (Kelly For Brickwork Tee)
description:
100% cotton white pocket tee, printed on the back with KELLY FOR BRICKWORK.
In 1920 at the age of thirty-one, Jack Kelly, a Philadelphia bricklayer and local sporting hero, had won six national sculling titles and was unbeaten in 126 consecutive races. He set his sights on the Henley Royal Regatta that year, with every intention of continuing his winning streak. But the Henley Stewards denied his entry, citing an ongoing ban on entries from his club (which had run afoul of the Stewards years earlier) and an old rule that prevented manual laborers — bricklayers included — from racing. The news caused an uproar in Philadelphia, where “Kelly for Brickwork” were long a frequent sight within the rowing community. Weeks after Henley, Kelly had his revenge: he won gold at the Olympics, beating the Henley singles champion, Jack Beresford of Great Britain, by one second. Half an hour later, he made history by winning gold in the doubles event as well. According to legend, he mailed his racing cap to King George V with a note reading, “Greetings from a bricklayer.” The Kelly family eventually made its peace with Henley. His son, John Jr., won the Diamond Sculls at the rega a in 1947 and 1949. And his daughter, Grace, presented the prizes at Henley in 1981... in her capacity as Princess of Monaco.
Unisex. Runs true to size (men's sizes).

title: 3-roll-2 single breasted blazer (All-American Navy Hopsack blazer with "swelled seam" topstitch)
description:
The perfect American-style navy blue blazer in lightweight hopsack, milled in Connecticut. Handmade in New York. 100% lightweight wool hopsack. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets. Top-stitched "swelled seam" edges and pockets.
Our handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. Cross-stitched Latin motto AVT VIAM INVENIAM AVT FACIAM under lapel. Rowing Blazers house button in brass, made in Connecticut. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Props not included.
This blazer has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 come in both regular and long. Model is 5'11" and wears a 40.
"I wanted to create the perfect navy blazer; the blazer I always wanted, and the blazer every man deserves to have. This is our most understated blazer, but it still reflects our aesthetic and character. The three-roll-two silhouette, ventless back, flannel finish: these are qualities a proper blazer is supposed to have. Many have forgotten, but we shall remind them! Details like the single cuff buttons; the vitreous enamel buttonhole badge; and the hidden, cross-stitched motto (which translates to 'I shall either find a way, or make a way,' erroneously attributed to Hannibal, as he led his elephant cavalry over the Alps) are subtle, crispy and cryptic. This is the all-American lightweight hopsack version of our more English flannel navy topstitch blazer." - Jack

title: 100% Pima Cotton Polo (Authentic Polo Shirt with Satin Stripe - Orange)
description:
100% pima cotton real piqué polo jersey with a genuine, hand-sewn diagonal satin stripe. Authentic, but also modern and uncomplicated.
Three-button placket (the good ol' fashioned way). Split tail. No logo on chest, because, come on, you either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing. 100% Peruvian pima cotton. Props not included.
Unisex (men's sizing). Classic / oversized fit. For a more fitted look, order one size down.
"This shirt is based on a vintage Yale polo jersey from the early 80s: it was beautiful. Navy blue soft pima cotton (no tech-y fabrics) with a hand-stitched white satin stripe - not too wide - running diagonally across the front. No one makes polo shirts like these (until now), and there's a reason why: it's not easy, because the pima cotton is a knit, and the satin is a woven. It has to be sewn by hand. But it's worthwhile, because the result is just right. I would never buy a pieced piqué diagonal stripe polo shirt; but this is a different animal altogether. You feel like Laddie Sanford, or like Steve McQueen in the Thomas Crown Affair. But it's also modern and uncomplicated. Our polos don't have any logo on the chest, because I like it that way; I either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing." - Jack

title: Pima Cotton and Satin Polo Shirt (Official Harriman Cup Polo Jersey)
description:
100% pima cotton polo jersey with genuine satin diagonal stripe, based on a vintage jersey. Exact replica Harriman Cup match jersey. Twill letter "V" on front; twill number and hand-embroidered goldwork Harriman Cup badge on back.
Rowing Blazers is proud to sponsor the Harriman Cup: the annual Yale-Virginia polo match and fundraiser, contested for the past three decades in honor of diplomat, polo player and former New York Governor Averell Harriman. A non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the sport of polo and supporting the polo programs at Yale and UVA, the Harriman Cup has raised over $1 million since its inception. This year's match will be held on September 16 at Bethpage State Park, Long Island. Rowing Blazers is proud to produce the official Harriman Cup team jerseys, blazers and the Rowing Blazers x Harriman Cup capsule.
100% pima cotton. Genuine navy satin diagonal stripe. Twill letter on front and number on back (back number will vary). Hand-embroidered goldwork Harriman Cup badge on back.
Unisex (men's sizing).

title: Wide-wale Corduroy Jacket (Extra Soft Corduroy Jacket in Dusty Rose)
description:
Hand-tailored jacket in extra soft, wide-wale Italian corduroy. Handmade in New York. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets. Hidden cross-stitched proverb ("O Tempora! O Mores!") under lapel.
Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. House brass buttons. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Props not included.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long. Model is 5'11" and wears a 40.
"Corde-du-roi" ("cord of the king") is the mythical origin for the modern word "corduroy." In reality, the material originated as an industrial workwear fabric. We prefer the more regal connotation. And that's why, while most corduroy jackets - even the expensive ones - feel stiff and starchy, ours is super soft. Made from luxurious Italian wide-wale corduroy, our jacket is velvet-y enough to nap in. Hand-tailored in New York City with a Latin proverb (Cicero's "O Tempora! O Mores!") stitched under the lapel, this jacket is fit for a king. It's unlined in the back and perfect for September-March.

title: 100% Pima Cotton Polo (Authentic Polo Shirt with Satin Stripe - Purple)
description:
100% pima cotton real piqué polo jersey with a genuine, hand-sewn diagonal satin stripe. Authentic, but also modern and uncomplicated.
Three-button placket (the good ol' fashioned way). Split tail. No logo on chest, because, come on, you either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing. 100% Peruvian pima cotton. Props not included.
Unisex (men's sizing). Classic / oversized fit. For a more fitted look, order one size down.
"This shirt is based on a vintage Yale polo jersey from the early 80s: it was beautiful. Navy blue soft pima cotton (no tech-y fabrics) with a hand-stitched white satin stripe - not too wide - running diagonally across the front. No one makes polo shirts like these (until now), and there's a reason why: it's not easy, because the pima cotton is a knit, and the satin is a woven. It has to be sewn by hand. But it's worthwhile, because the result is just right. I would never buy a pieced piqué diagonal stripe polo shirt; but this is a different animal altogether. You feel like Laddie Sanford, or like Steve McQueen in the Thomas Crown Affair. But it's also modern and uncomplicated. Our polos don't have any logo on the chest, because I like it that way; I either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing." - Jack

title: 100% Cotton T-Shirt (John's Pizzeria of Bleecker Street T-Shirt - White)
description:
100% cotton John's of Bleecker Street t-shirt in white. This is the same shirt worn by the guys behind the counter at the historic John's of Bleecker Street pizzeria in Greenwich Village.
This is a 100% authentic John's of Bleecker tee - approved by John's Pizzeria and the same design that's worn by the guys serving up pies. Founded in 1929 by John Sasso, John's is known for its strict NO SLICES policy, and for having the oldest pizza oven still operating in New York City. John's is probably the most consistent pie in the city, and one of the few institutions in the city still using an authentic coal-fired oven.
Unisex. Runs true to size (men's sizes).

title: 100% Cotton T-Shirt (Imperial College Boat Club Long Sleeve Tee)
description:
100% Cotton Long Sleeve T-shirt.
We’ve partnered with two of Britain’s most successful and storied student rowing clubs: Imperial and Oxford Brookes. Last year’s Henley was a historic regatta for these two clubs, with Imperial taking the Wyfold Challenge Cup and Brookes taking a double win in the Temple Challenge Cup and the Ladies’ Challenge Plate. This year they are looking for victories again. We’re proud to work with these two clubs, and a portion of the proceeds from these items will go directly to support rowing at Imperial and Brookes.

title: Row New York Rugby Shirt (Queens Rugby Shirt - Noah x Rowing Blazers)
description:
Part of a limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Noah, in support of Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. The program serves over 4000 kids from all five boroughs, mostly from the city's under-resourced communities. Vertical stripe rugby shirt with oversized Queens embroidery on the back. 100% cotton.
Rugby collar. R.B. logo beneath placket; Noah logo on left cuff; large satin-stitched borough embroidery on back. Made in Canada.
This rugby runs trim. We recommend ordering one size up. Unisex.
15% of all sales will go directly to Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. Both Rowing Blazers and Noah are NYC-based brands, and it means a lot to both to be able to partner with a program that has a direct impact on the community in which they create. 100% of kids at Row New York graduate high school and 99% go on to college; 100% exceed the CDC's recommended daily activity levels. Needless to say, these are much higher than city averages. 84% of participants row for free, and 53% come from families with a household income under $30,000. Over half will become first generation college students

title: Coaches Jacket (Harry's New York Bar Jacket)
description:
Nylon coaches jacket emblazoned with Harry's famous bar flies motif on the back and Harry's New York Bar address on the front chest. Props not included.
100% nylon. Made in USA. Props not included.
Relaxed fit.
Harry's is a legendary institution that made its mark in the worlds of literature, music, art, politics - and of course drinking. Established in 1911, Harry's New York Bar is the birthplace of the Bloody Mary, the Side Car, the French 75, and a long list of other iconic cocktails. The bar itself - decorated with wood panelling, foreign banknotes, the shields of Oxford and Cambridge colleges, and, most notably, vintage American collegiate banners and felt pennants - was a favorite watering hole for the likes of Jean-Paul Sartre, Ernest Hemingway, Rita Hayworth, Jack Dempsey, the Duke of Windsor, Thornton Wilder, Marlene Dietrich, Humphrey Bogart, and Coco Chanel. The Piano Room downstairs was frequented by Gershwin, who composed "An American in Paris" there. Harry's New York Bar continues to be a gathering place for intellectuals, celebrities, sportsmen and rakes. Many have been inducted into Harry's very own secret society, the International Bar Flies (or I.B.F.), whose icon - two cartoon flies - adorn the mirror behind the bar. To this day, Harry's is known for its limited menu: a wide variety of the best cocktails in Paris, and to eat... only hot dogs.

Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. House brass buttons. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Props not included.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long. Model is 6'0" and wears a 40.
"Corde-du-roi" ("cord of the king") is the mythical origin for the modern word "corduroy." In reality, the material originated as an industrial workwear fabric. We prefer the more regal connotation. And that's why, while most corduroy jackets - even the expensive ones - feel stiff and starchy, ours is super soft. Made from luxurious Italian wide-wale corduroy, our jacket is velvet-y enough to nap in. Hand-tailored in New York City with a Latin proverb (Cicero's "O Tempora! O Mores!") stitched under the lapel, this jacket is fit for a king. It's unlined in the back and perfect for September-March.

title: 100% Pima Cotton Polo (Authentic Polo Shirt with Satin Stripe - Green)
description:
100% pima cotton real piqué polo jersey with a genuine, hand-sewn diagonal satin stripe. Authentic, but also modern and uncomplicated.
Three-button placket (the good ol' fashioned way). Split tail. No logo on chest, because, come on, you either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing. 100% Peruvian pima cotton. Props not included.
Unisex (men's sizing). Classic / oversized fit. For a more fitted look, order one size down.
"This shirt is based on a vintage Yale polo jersey from the early 80s: it was beautiful. Navy blue soft pima cotton (no tech-y fabrics) with a hand-stitched white satin stripe - not too wide - running diagonally across the front. No one makes polo shirts like these (until now), and there's a reason why: it's not easy, because the pima cotton is a knit, and the satin is a woven. It has to be sewn by hand. But it's worthwhile, because the result is just right. I would never buy a pieced piqué diagonal stripe polo shirt; but this is a different animal altogether. You feel like Laddie Sanford, or like Steve McQueen in the Thomas Crown Affair. But it's also modern and uncomplicated. Our polos don't have any logo on the chest, because I like it that way; I either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing." - Jack

description:

Rowing Blazers is proud to sponsor the Harriman Cup: the annual Yale-Virginia polo match and fundraiser, contested for the past three decades in honor of diplomat, polo player and former New York Governor Averell Harriman. A non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the sport of polo and supporting the polo programs at Yale and UVA, the Harriman Cup has raised over $1 million since its inception. This year's match will be held on September 16 at Bethpage State Park, Long Island. Rowing Blazers is proud to produce the official Harriman Cup team jerseys, blazers and the Rowing Blazers x Harriman Cup capsule.
Unisex. Runs true to size (men's sizes).

title: Super Heavyweight Rugby by Sports D'Epoque (England-Wales 1923 authentic heavyweight rugby)
description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) white rugby jersey with embroidered rose and Prince of Wales' feathers. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; four-button placket; gorgeous rib knit cuffs.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
On November 1st, 1923, in the town of Rugby, England, some two thousand rugby enthusiasts gathered to celebrate the 100-year anniversary of the first ever rugby match. A combined England-Wales side, wearing white jerseys emblazoned with the rose of England and the feathers of Wales, faced off against a combined Ireland-Scotland side, and narrowly won. One hundred years earlier in 1823, the story goes, a student at Rugby School named William Webb Ellis displayed (to quote a plaque at the school) "a fine disregard for the rules of football, took the ball into his hands, and ran with it", inadvertently inventing Rugby football.

description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) white rugby jersey with blue and red inverted chevron "V" stripes. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; three-button placket; gorgeous rib knit cuffs.

In 1895, the sport of rugby split into two codes: the traditional “Rugby Union” and the more working-class “Rugby League.” Over time, the rules of the two codes developed and diverged, and today Rugby League is a fast-paced version of the game popular in northern England, Australia, and New Zealand. While traditional Rugby Union jerseys are either solid colors or horizontal stripes, Rugby League jerseys traditionally use an inverted chevron “V” pattern, ironically invoking the design of a traditional cricket or tennis sweater.

title: Chocolate Brown Mountain Boot
description:
For years we searched for the perfect boot. A boot that is not as frumpy as a desert boot nor as slick as a Chelsea. A boot that is durable and light but also soft and comfortable. A modern boot that says ‘yeah I’m an outdoors guy’ but doesn’t actually make you feel obligated to go for a hike. An elegant boot that can be worn to the office or casually on weekends. An all rounder that will fill so many gaps in your wardrobe that you won’t know how you ever lived without it.Hand made in Tuscany from the softest of chocolate brown suedes, with its elegant lines and our specially developed P Johnson light weight all weather rubber sole, this is the boot that you have all been waiting for. Made in limited numbers, all at width D.Note: We do not actually recommend that you hike in this boot because you probably will end up rolling your ankle.
Details and Care:- Genuine leather (suede) with rubber sole- Made in Italy- Spot clean with specific leather care products

title: Busted-seam button-down shirt (Pink Distressed Oxford with Busted Seams)
description:
The perfect Oxford shirt with reverse ("busted") seams. Handmade and distressed in the U.S.A. 100% Japanese cotton Oxford cloth. Hand distressed collar and cuffs.
Enzyme washed for softness. Soft S-roll button down collar. Pure cotton buttons. American placket. Rowing Blazers sandpaper card included for additional at-home distressing. (Props not included.)
This shirt has a modern cut. Model is 5'11" and wears a Medium.
"I had an Oxford cloth button-down shirt that I practically lived in. I wore it while excavating in Italy; hiking in Patagonia; celebrating at Henley after exhilarating victories; drowning my sorrows at Henley after gutting losses; I wore it to elegant dinners and to many more greasy spoons. The collar and cuffs wore down and frayed with years of use, and seams started to come apart. And it just felt right. We've recreated that feeling -- without overdoing it, but also without kidding ourselves, with just the right amount of tongue-in-cheek. That's why we include a piece of sandpaper with each shirt, printed on the reverse with a withering quote by the great Edward Said about his Princeton roommates who used to sand the collars of their BDs." - Jack

Hidden rib cuff. Rib underarm gusset. “Henry” label under collar. Rubber rugby button. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Ventless. Props not included.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long.
"The original blazers were the hoodies of their day, and I wanted to honor that heritage by creating a casual blazer in cotton jersey. We developed this premium heavyweight jersey fabric ourselves, and it couldn’t have come out better. As with everything else in the collection, there is a painstaking attention to detail with this jacket: it features a hidden rib cuff inside the sleeve and rib underarm gussets. Ineffably cool and deeply traditional, this is the most comfortable and most versatile blazer a guy (or girl) can own.” - Jack

title: 100% Cotton T-Shirt (Shaggy Dog Tee)
description:
100% cotton white t-shirt with printed Shaggy Dog label. Part of a limited edition Rowing Blazers x J.Press collaboration.
Rowing Blazers founder Jack Carlson grew up in Cambridge, Mass., and bought his first Shaggy Dog sweater from J. Press in Harvard Square when he was in high school. “We don’t make sweaters at Rowing Blazers, and the Shaggy Dog is not only a J. Press icon, but it’s a staple of traditional American menswear period,” he said. “I love the vintage label on my old Shaggy Dog sweater, with the little drawing of the dog. It was a natural fit to collaborate and put a tongue-in-cheek spin on the Shaggy Dog sweater.”
Unisex. Runs true to size (men's sizes).

title: The "Prince Charlie" Blazer (8x3 Double Breasted Blazer)
description:
8x3 double breasted blazer (8 buttons, 3 rows closing). Handmade in New York. 100% American wool. Three pockets.
Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. Cross-stitched Latin motto VBI MEL IBI APES under lapel. Eight brass bee buttons struck from a vintage die on front. Five working brass beehive cuff buttons struck from a vintage die on each cuff. Lined in navy and green house stripe. Double vents.
This blazer has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 come in both regular and long. Model is 5’11” and wears a 40.
"H.R.H. The Prince of Wales has an 8x3 double breasted blazer he has worn often for the past several decades. It looks as great today as it did in the 1970s. 8x3 refers to the total number of buttons on the front, eight, and the number or rows that button, three: this is a sharp, old-school cut that few have had the cojones to make in recent years. Ours is handmade in New York, and, like Charlie’s, has five working buttons on each cuff. The Drones Club buttons on the front and matching beehive cuff buttons complement the secret stitching under the lapel, VBI MEL IBI APES: ‘You catch more bees with honey.’ Happy honey-catching.” - Jack

title: Row New York Rugby Shirt (Staten Island Rugby Shirt - Noah x Rowing Blazers)
description:
Part of a limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Noah, in support of Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. The program serves over 4000 kids from all five boroughs, mostly from the city's under-resourced communities. Vertical stripe rugby shirt with oversized Staten Island embroidery on the back. 100% cotton.
Rugby collar. R.B. logo beneath placket; Noah logo on left cuff; large satin-stitched borough embroidery on back. Made in Canada.
This rugby runs trim. We recommend ordering one size up. Unisex.
15% of all sales will go directly to Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. Both Rowing Blazers and Noah are NYC-based brands, and it means a lot to both to be able to partner with a program that has a direct impact on the community in which they create. 100% of kids at Row New York graduate high school and 99% go on to college; 100% exceed the CDC's recommended daily activity levels. Needless to say, these are much higher than city averages. 84% of participants row for free, and 53% come from families with a household income under $30,000. Over half will become first generation college students

title: Navy Weatherproof Utility Vest
description:
Made from a waterproof cotton blend, woven in Italy. It's hard being a man sometimes, where do we put all our stuff when we're out and about? I'm not sold on carrying a man bag. I don't mind a backpack but when you need to return videotapes in a hurry they're annoying to take on and off, not to mention the damage they do to your jacket. This utility vest is the answer to all your problems. It's really handy for travelling, perfect for storing anything from movie tickets to passports and vape pens.To keep your travellers cheques safe we've added a hidden money belt in the back panel. You can wear it over tailored clothing or just by itself with a bit of knitwear. Once you've got one of these you won't know how you lived without it. Also available made-to-measure in our showrooms, in your choice of cloth.
Details and Care: - 59%CO 41%NY- Gentle cold machine wash, dry in shade, wash separately, do not tumble dry, do not bleach- Dry cleanable- Imported

description:
100% Cotton Long Sleeve T-shirt.
We’ve partnered with two of Britain’s most successful and storied student rowing clubs: Imperial and Oxford Brookes. Last year’s Henley was a historic regatta for these two clubs, with Imperial taking the Wyfold Challenge Cup and Brookes taking a double win in the Temple Challenge Cup and the Ladies’ Challenge Plate. This year they are looking for victories again. We’re proud to work with these two clubs, and a portion of the proceeds from these items will go directly to support rowing at Imperial and Brookes.

title: 100% Cotton T-Shirt (Hasty Pudding HPT Pot Tee)
description:
Made in USA.
The Hasty Pudding is one of Harvard's oldest student societies. The Pudding is best known for its annual comedy musical productions that tour New York and Bermuda each spring. Five presidents have been members (John Adams, John Quincy Adams, Theodore Roosevelt, FDR and JFK). More recent alums include Andy Borowitz (creator of The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air) and Rashida Jones. We tapped into their emblems and their tongue-in-cheek vintage illustrations - most of which feature the club's icons, the crocodile, sphinx, and pudding pot. The Pudding's sense of history and sense of irony complement the Rowing Blazers brand perfectly.
Unisex. Runs true to size (men's sizes).

Woven in Switzerland, this 100% superfine cotton airtex (giro inglese) is so light to wear it’s like a whisper on the body. Details and care: - 100 % Cotton - Imported - Warm to cold machine wash with similar colours, do not bleach, medium iron, P dry clean (any dry cleaning solvent other than trichloroethylene may be safely used), do not tumble dry

title: Spread Collar Shirt (White Oxford with Busted Seams)
description:

This shirt has a modern cut. Model is 5'11" and wears a Medium.
"The best pieces in menswear are the result of combining seemingly incongruous ideas: high-brow and low-brow, formal and casual. I wanted to take the classic, comfortable Oxford cloth generally used for American button-downs, and make a traditional, proper English spread collar shirt. The busted seams keep it funky and perfectly imperfect." - Jack

title: Tricker's Limited Edition Moc Croc Leather Brogue Shoe
description: Founded in 1829, Tricker's is one of England's longest established shoemakers. They first gained their popularity as a producer of handmade country brogue boots and now provide footwear for the British Royal Household.  The Northampton, family-owned, 180 year old label has upheld high standards of quality and craftsmanship; employing over 260 individual processes to craft each pair and only producing 1,400 pairs a week. Each of our exclusive pairs comes with a Todd Snyder inner stamp as well as our signature back loop tab.Details:- Color: Black Moc Croc- Sole: Double Leather- Welt: Flat- Eyelets: Blind- Laces: Black

title: Row New York Blazer (Brooklyn Blazer - Noah x Rowing Blazers)
description:
Part of a limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Noah, in support of Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. The program serves over 4000 kids from all five boroughs, mostly from the city's under-resourced communities. Striped blazer with Brooklyn embroidery on the chest pocket. Hand-tailored in New York City. Year-round wool-cotton; 3-roll-2 silhouette.
Rowing Blazers house button in brass. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Hidden-stitch patch pockets.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-44 run regular.
15% of all sales will go directly to Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. Both Rowing Blazers and Noah are NYC-based brands, and it means a lot to both to be able to partner with a program that has a direct impact on the community in which they create. 100% of kids at Row New York graduate high school and 99% go on to college; 100% exceed the CDC's recommended daily activity levels. Needless to say, these are much higher than city averages. 84% of participants row for free, and 53% come from families with a household income under $30,000. Over half will become first generation college students.

title: 100% Pima Cotton Polo (Authentic Polo Shirt with Satin Stripe - Navy)
description:
100% pima cotton real piqué polo jersey with a genuine, hand-sewn diagonal satin stripe. Authentic, but also modern and uncomplicated.
Three-button placket (the good ol' fashioned way). Split tail. No logo on chest, because, come on, you either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing. 100% Peruvian pima cotton. Props not included.
Unisex (men's sizing). Classic / oversized fit. For a more fitted look, order one size down.
"This shirt is based on a vintage Yale polo jersey from the early 80s: it was beautiful. Navy blue soft pima cotton (no tech-y fabrics) with a hand-stitched white satin stripe - not too wide - running diagonally across the front. No one makes polo shirts like these (until now), and there's a reason why: it's not easy, because the pima cotton is a knit, and the satin is a woven. It has to be sewn by hand. But it's worthwhile, because the result is just right. I would never buy a pieced piqué diagonal stripe polo shirt; but this is a different animal altogether. You feel like Laddie Sanford, or like Steve McQueen in the Thomas Crown Affair. But it's also modern and uncomplicated. Our polos don't have any logo on the chest, because I like it that way; I either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing." - Jack

title: Corduroy Dad Hat (Luke Edward Hall Statue Bust Cap)
description:
Green corduroy dad hat with hand-embroidered Luke Edward Hall statue bust. This is a limited edition collaboration. Please allow an extra 7-10 days for shipping.
London-based artist Luke Edward Hall and Rowing Blazers founder Jack Carlson share a love for the Classical world. In Luke’s case, it’s an aesthetic fascination: the architecture of Greco-Roman temples, and the human and divine body in sculpture. For Jack, it’s an academic pursuit: before establishing the New York-based menswear brand in 2017, he was a field archaeologist in Italy and earned a PhD in Roman archaeology at Oxford. The two met in 2014 when Jack’s book – also called Rowing Blazers – was published. But they reconnected when Rowing Blazers launched as a brand, and the idea of a collaboration came naturally to both of them. The capsule is based on a series of five illustrations by Luke Edward Hall inspired by the ancient world: a Greek vase; the mask of Tutankhamun; a discus-thrower; a set of ionic columns in ruin; and a statue bust.
Adjustable. One size fits most.

The rugby shirt has its origins in traditional British sport, but it’s found its way into the menswear canon, where it commands serious respect in the diverse worlds of streetwear, prep, and “dad style.” We’re incredibly proud of the accolades our rugbies have earned, and we see ourselves as stewards of the rugby shirt tradition. Fellow rugby shirt devotees, take heart and stay tuned for more.

title: Busted-seam button-down shirt (Blue Distressed Oxford with Busted Seams)
description:
The perfect Oxford shirt with reverse ("busted") seams. Handmade and distressed in the U.S.A. 100% Japanese cotton Oxford cloth. Hand distressed collar and cuffs.
Enzyme washed for softness. Soft S-roll button down collar. Pure cotton buttons. American placket. Rowing Blazers sandpaper card included for additional at-home distressing. (Props not included.)
This shirt has a modern cut. Model is 5'11" and wears a Medium.
"I had an Oxford cloth button-down shirt that I practically lived in. I wore it while excavating in Italy; hiking in Patagonia; celebrating at Henley after exhilarating victories; drowning my sorrows at Henley after gutting losses; I wore it to elegant dinners and to many more greasy spoons. The collar and cuffs wore down and frayed with years of use, and seams started to come apart. And it just felt right. We've recreated that feeling -- without overdoing it, but also without kidding ourselves, with just the right amount of tongue-in-cheek. That's why we include a piece of sandpaper with each shirt, printed on the reverse with a withering quote by the great Edward Said about his Princeton roommates who used to sand the collars of their BDs." - Jack

title: Corduroy Dad Hat (Harry's New York Bar Cap)
description:
Dark green corduroy dad hat satin-stitched with Harry's famous bar flies motif. Made in USA. Props not included.
Adjustable corduroy strap in back. Made in USA. Props not included.
Adjustable. One size fits most.
Harry's is a legendary institution that made its mark in the worlds of literature, music, art, politics - and of course drinking. Established in 1911, Harry's New York Bar is the birthplace of the Bloody Mary, the Side Car, the French 75, and a long list of other iconic cocktails. The bar itself - decorated with wood panelling, foreign banknotes, the shields of Oxford and Cambridge colleges, and, most notably, vintage American collegiate banners and felt pennants - was a favorite watering hole for the likes of Jean-Paul Sartre, Ernest Hemingway, Rita Hayworth, Jack Dempsey, the Duke of Windsor, Thornton Wilder, Marlene Dietrich, Humphrey Bogart, and Coco Chanel. The Piano Room downstairs was frequented by Gershwin, who composed "An American in Paris" there. Harry's New York Bar continues to be a gathering place for intellectuals, celebrities, sportsmen and rakes. Many have been inducted into Harry's very own secret society, the International Bar Flies (or I.B.F.), whose icon - two cartoon flies - adorn the mirror behind the bar. To this day, Harry's is known for its limited menu: a wide variety of the best cocktails in Paris, and to eat... only hot dogs.

title: Cashmere T-Shirt Sweater in Black
description: The ultimate year round cashmere. title: 3-roll-2 single breasted blazer (Navy blazer with cream trim)
description:
Navy blazer with cream grosgrain trim. Handmade in New York. 100% year-round wool flannel. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets. Cream grosgrain trim on edge of blazer and top edge of pockets.
Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. Cross-stitched Latin motto FORSAN ET HAEC under lapel. Rowing Blazers house button in brass, made in Connecticut. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Props not included.
This blazer has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 come in both regular and long. Model is 5'11" and wears a 40.
"This is the quintessential rowing blazer. Many have tried to replicate it, but there is much more to it than the grosgrain trim. Years of research, travel, interviews, and vintage recon went into my book, and this blazer is the beneficiary. It isn't a glorified sport coat with grosgrain trim. The devil is in the details: the effortless roll of the lapel and three-roll-two expression; the hidden-stitch patch pockets; the unlined back and the brushed flannel finish; even the interior back panel, which is hand-cut with pinking shears. The blazer comes with a cloisonné buttonhole badge, handmade in England from vitreous enamel, and cross-stitched Latin under the lapel. Another Latin motto adorns the buttons, for those with a keen enough eye." - Jack

The first Australian national rugby team to be nicknamed "The Wallabies" won 32 victories out of 38 matches and an Olympic gold medal during its 1908-1909 British tour. The team, principally from New South Wales, wore the light blue and Waratah flower badge of that state, rather than the gold and green uniform more commonly associated with the Wallabies today, but with the name "Australia" embroidered beneath the flower.

title: Pink Stripe Oxford Button Down Shirt
description:
We love Oxford button down shirts. They are the perfect shirt for so many occasions. There is no wonder why they have become the go to shirt for some of the world's best dressed men.
So how have we improved on this classic piece?
Well, we started with the cloth. We searched everywhere for an Oxford cloth with body and substance but one that is also soft. An Oxford that ages like a good Oxford should. An Oxford that will be with you through the good times and bad. An Oxford that really becomes part of the family. An Oxford that is not going to moan and complain if it's scrunched up at bottom of your bag. An Oxford that doesn't retaliate and crease-up like its more delicate contemporaries. It's an Oxford that understands that you're busy and is just happy to be involved. It's a resilient little Oxford. An Oxford that is made like Oxford cloth used to be made. It's everything you are looking for in an Oxford and more importantly everything you need from a friend.
Next we made a few tweaks to the basic design. The classic button down collar has been usurped by an elegant one piece construction. The pocket is slightly larger than usual and set a touch lower so the shirt has a more relaxed image. The stitching is finer and set at a tighter spacing, and the cut is a little slimmer than your classic American boxy button down.
Order now as this could be the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
Details and Care:- 100% cotton- Made in Poland- Cold gentle machine wash, warm iron, do not bleach

title: 1973 POLO - Black

Rowing Blazers is proud to sponsor the Harriman Cup: the annual Yale-Virginia polo match and fundraiser, contested for the past three decades in honor of diplomat, polo player and former New York Governor Averell Harriman. A non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the sport of polo and supporting the polo programs at Yale and UVA, the Harriman Cup has raised over $1 million since its inception. This year's match will be held on September 16 at Bethpage State Park, Long Island. Rowing Blazers is proud to produce the official Harriman Cup team jerseys, blazers and the Rowing Blazers x Harriman Cup capsule.
Adjustable strap in back.

title: Row New York Blazer (Staten Island Blazer - Noah x Rowing Blazers)
description:
Part of a limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Noah, in support of Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. The program serves over 4000 kids from all five boroughs, mostly from the city's under-resourced communities. Striped blazer with Staten Island embroidery on the chest pocket. Hand-tailored in New York City. Year-round wool-cotton; 3-roll-2 silhouette.
Rowing Blazers house button in brass. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Hidden-stitch patch pockets.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-44 run regular.
15% of all sales will go directly to Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. Both Rowing Blazers and Noah are NYC-based brands, and it means a lot to both to be able to partner with a program that has a direct impact on the community in which they create. 100% of kids at Row New York graduate high school and 99% go on to college; 100% exceed the CDC's recommended daily activity levels. Needless to say, these are much higher than city averages. 84% of participants row for free, and 53% come from families with a household income under $30,000. Over half will become first generation college students.

description:

100% wool. Made in the United States to military specifications. Props not included.
The annual Varsity Race in the Netherlands is one of the most historic, prestigious rowing events in the world and home to many of the sport’s greatest and most eccentric traditions. These include the naked swim out to the victorious crew; the traditional blazer-fights; and the post-race kroegjool festivities. This year marks the 135th Varsity. To celebrate, Rowing Blazers has made a special capsule collection co-branded with The Varsity using their historic Jutphaas emblem.
One size fits most.

description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) red and cream striped rugby jersey with embroidered cherry blossoms. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.

While rugby is an old sport in Japan (the nation's first rugby club, Yokohama Football Club, was established in 1866), the first national team was only created in 1930. Their first international match was in Vancouver, but it was on the 31st of January, 1932, that the "Cherry Blossoms" played at home for the first time. In a packed Hanazono Rugby Stadium, in front of some 25,000 triumphant spectators, they won this first home match: 9 to 8, against the Canadians.

title: Japanese Wool Necktie (Biker Wings Tie)
description:
Handmade in New York. 100% Japanese wool. Single embroidered biker wings motif.
"Tipsy" Latin address label on back. (Props not included).
One size. 2 7/8 inches wide.
"The complex, meaningful ‘heraldry,’ if it may be so called, of biker gangs is not so different from the system of sartorial one-upmanship of club, school and regimental ties. Man is a tribal creature: he yearns for symbols of belonging, status, distinction. Ceremonial robes, chiefly headdresses, academic gowns, heraldic tabards, and even military uniforms and business ‘power suits’ do not play as central a role in daily life as they may have in other times and places. But symbolic trappings are everywhere, hiding in plain sight." - Jack

title: Washed Twill Dad Hat (Hasty Pudding Sphinx Cap - Light Blue)
description:
Light blue washed twill dad hat with hand-embroidered sphinx.
The Hasty Pudding is one of Harvard's oldest student societies. The Pudding is best known for its annual comedy musical productions that tour New York and Bermuda each spring. Five presidents have been members (John Adams, John Quincy Adams, Theodore Roosevelt, FDR and JFK). More recent alums include Andy Borowitz (creator of The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air) and Rashida Jones. We tapped into their emblems and their tongue-in-cheek vintage illustrations - most of which feature the club's icons, the crocodile, sphinx, and pudding pot. The Pudding's sense of history and sense of irony complement the Rowing Blazers brand perfectly.
Adjustable. One size fits most.

title: Japanese Wool Necktie (Luke Edward Hall Tutankhamun Tie)
description:
Handmade in New York. 100% Japanese wool. Single embroidered Luke Edward Hall Tutankhamun mask.
One size. 2 7/8 inches wide.
London-based artist Luke Edward Hall and Rowing Blazers founder Jack Carlson share a love for the Classical world. In Luke’s case, it’s an aesthetic fascination: the architecture of Greco-Roman temples, and the human and divine body in sculpture. For Jack, it’s an academic pursuit: before establishing the New York-based menswear brand in 2017, he was a field archaeologist in Italy and earned a PhD in Roman archaeology at Oxford. The two met in 2014 when Jack’s book – also called Rowing Blazers – was published. But they reconnected when Rowing Blazers launched as a brand, and the idea of a collaboration came naturally to both of them. The capsule is based on a series of five illustrations by Luke Edward Hall inspired by the ancient world: a Greek vase; the mask of Tutankhamun; a discus-thrower; a set of ionic columns in ruin; and a statue bust.

description:

"Oarsmen often repurpose boat straps – used to secure rowing shells on transport trailers – for belts. Ours is a more rugged, heavy-duty variation, with a distressed nickel cam buckle and a cross-stitched Latin motto. And unlike leather belts, no animals died in the making of this belt." - Jack

title: Wind Vintage (Late 1960s Glycine Airman reference 323.1119)
description: The Glycine Airman was a watch popular with American pilots and soldiers during the Vietnam War and has 24-hour time, meaning that the hour hand only rotates once per day. This is one of the nicest I have seen, with an unpolished case and mint dial, plus it retains the original pin that holds the seconds hand at 12:00 when setting it, which is sort of a primitive “hacking” function so the seconds hand does not continue to run when setting the time. This watch is currently on view at the Rowing Blazers Clubhouse at 161 Grand Street in New York City. Curated by Wind Vintage. Ships separately. Please allow an additional 7-10 days for delivery. Contact eric@windvintage.com for inquiries.

description:

"I used to hate button-down collar shirts. But that’s because most in the market had short, flat, little collars and were made of cheap material. Then I discovered vintage button-downs, with their perfectly imperfect collar rolls and soft and heavy-duty, textured Oxford cloth. This is the perfect S-roll collar button-down shirt, made in the U.S.A., featuring light distressing on the collar and cuff, and enzyme washed for extra softness." - Jack

title: Red Stripe Oxford Button Down Shirt
description:
We love Oxford button down shirts. They are the perfect shirt for so many occasions. There is no wonder why they have become the go to shirt for some of the world's best dressed men.
So how have we improved on this classic piece?
Well, we started with the cloth. We searched everywhere for an Oxford cloth with body and substance but one that is also soft. An Oxford that ages like a good Oxford should. An Oxford that will be with you through the good times and bad. An Oxford that really becomes part of the family. An Oxford that is not going to moan and complain if it's scrunched up at bottom of your bag. An Oxford that doesn't retaliate and crease-up like its more delicate contemporaries. It's an Oxford that understands that you're busy and is just happy to be involved. It's a resilient little Oxford. An Oxford that is made like Oxford cloth used to be made. It's everything you are looking for in an Oxford and more importantly everything you need from a friend.
Next we made a few tweaks to the basic design. The classic button down collar has been usurped by an elegant one piece construction. The pocket is slightly larger than usual and set a touch lower so the shirt has a more relaxed image. The stitching is finer and set at a tighter spacing, and the cut is a little slimmer than your classic American boxy button down.
Order now as this could be the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
Details and Care:- 100% cotton- Made in Poland- Cold gentle machine wash, warm iron, do not bleach

title: Red Wing Moc Boot in Rough & Tough Leather in Black
description:
Red Wing’s Classic Work boots were designed and built to withstand the daily rigors of the work day on the farm and in the factory. The lightweight crepe sole featured a minimal tread design to reduce the mud that would cling to a farmer’s boots but still provide the underfoot comfort the work day required. Red Wing would brand the crepe sole as the Traction Tred sole. These classic boots featured a moc toe design. The name came from the word moccasin, the Algonquian Indian word for shoe. This combination of the u-shaped moc toe leather upper and the white crepe sole would become the iconic boot style for the Red Wing brand. It is one of the oldest Red Wing styles and a best-seller.
Product Details:
- Outsole: Traction Tred- Insole: Leather- Hardware: Nickel Eyelets- Construction: Goodyear Welt- Last: 23- Laces: 48 inch Black Tasman Lace
