title: Cotton Jersey Blazer (Cream Cotton Blazer with "Swelled Seam" Topstitch)
description:
Cream knit cotton jersey blazer with "swelled seam" topstitch. Handmade in New York. 100% American year-round heavyweight cotton jersey. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets.
Hidden rib cuff. Rib underarm gusset. “Henry” label under collar. Rowing Blazers house brass button. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Ventless.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long.
The original blazers were the hoodies of their day (warm-up jackets for Oxford and Cambridge rowers). We wanted to honor that heritage by creating a casual blazer in cotton jersey. We developed this premium American-knit French terry ourselves, and it couldn’t have come out better. But this isn’t a sweatshirt: each one is hand-tailored in the United States with a painstaking attention to detail. The most comfortable blazer a guy or girl can own.

title: Cotton twill blazer (Rugged Navy Varsity Blazer)
description:
The cotton twill version of our original navy blazer, in the style of the twill club blazers worn at the annual Dutch Varsity regatta. Handmade in New York. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets.
Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. Quarter-inch topstitch "swelled seam" detail. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Props not included.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long. Model is 6'0" and wears a 40.
We took our signature blazer fit and construction and rendered it in a rugged navy cotton twill, in the style of the cotton jackets worn at the annual Dutch Varsity regatta - where student rowers famously engage in semi-organized fights, grabbing each other by the lapels and trying to wrestle each other to the ground. Our cotton twill is sturdy enough to survive the occasional scuffle (it's been battle-tested), and breathable enough to be worn year round. With tonal navy buttons, this is the less flashy version of our classic navy wool blazer and a true wardrobe staple.

title: Blue and Cream Stripe Blazer (The Bloke Stripe Blazer)
description:
Striped blazer in navy, cream, and gold Japanese Cotton. Hand-tailored in New York City. Three patch pockets.
Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. Quarter-inch topstitch "swelled seam" detail. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Props not included.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long. Model is 6'0" and wears a 40.
We're naming this jacket in honor of a store we love in Pasadena, California: The Bloke. By choice, we don't work with many retailers; so when we do, it's special. Most of the shops we love and trust with our brand are in Japan (and happen to be, in our opinion, the world's leading men's shops): United Arrows, Beams Plus, Journal Standard, Maidens. But there was something about The Bloke - a Japan-influenced Anglo-Ivy-meets-L.A. concept store with a record shop attached to it, in a near-perfect recreation of London's Burlington Arcade - that seduced us. It didn't hurt that owner Jeffery Plansker is a fellow lover of vintage Jags. We're planting our flag in SoCal at The Bloke, and hope you'll check it out.

title: Cotton jersey blazer (Burgundy cotton blazer with cream trim)

Hidden rib cuff. Rib underarm gusset. “Henry” label under collar. Rubber rugby button. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Ventless. Props not included.
This blazer has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 come in both regular and long.
"The original blazers were the hoodies of their day, and I wanted to honor that heritage by creating a casual blazer in cotton jersey. We developed this premium heavyweight jersey fabric ourselves, and it couldn’t have come out better. As with everything else in the collection, there is a painstaking attention to detail with this jacket: it features a hidden rib cuff inside the sleeve and rib underarm gussets. Ineffably cool and deeply traditional, this is the most comfortable and most versatile blazer a guy (or girl) can own.” - Jack

title: Row New York Sweatpants (Staten Island Sweatpants - Noah x Rowing Blazers)
description:
Part of a limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Noah, in support of Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. The program serves over 4000 kids from all five boroughs, mostly from the city's under-resourced communities. Green sweatpants with Staten Island embroidery on the left leg. 100% cotton.
Limited edition Noah core logo with oars on back; borough embroidery on left leg. Made in Canada.
These sweatpants fit true to size (men's sizing). Unisex.
15% of all sales will go directly to Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. Both Rowing Blazers and Noah are NYC-based brands, and it means a lot to both to be able to partner with a program that has a direct impact on the community in which they create. 100% of kids at Row New York graduate high school and 99% go on to college; 100% exceed the CDC's recommended daily activity levels. Needless to say, these are much higher than city averages. 84% of participants row for free, and 53% come from families with a household income under $30,000. Over half will become first generation college students.

title: Shetland wool sweater (Shaggy Dog Sweater - Burgundy)
description:
100% Shetland wool sweater in burgundy featuring an oversized version of the vintage Shaggy Dog label on the chest. Made in Scotland. Part of a limited edition Rowing Blazers x J.Press collaboration.
100% Shetland wool. Made in Scotland.
This sweater is made in J.Press' original wide-body 'dad fit'.
Rowing Blazers founder Jack Carlson grew up in Cambridge, Mass., and bought his first Shaggy Dog sweater from J. Press in Harvard Square when he was in high school. “We don’t make sweaters at Rowing Blazers, and the Shaggy Dog is not only a J. Press icon, but it’s a staple of traditional American menswear period,” he said. “I love the vintage label on my old Shaggy Dog sweater, with the little drawing of the dog. It was a natural fit to collaborate and put a tongue-in-cheek spin on the Shaggy Dog sweater.”

Classic swim trunk. You can’t go wrong with the Swimmer’s timeless design, athletic fit and elasticated waist. Non-corrosive Everest Isles logo drawcord ends, back zip pocket and signature aqua stripe utility hook to hang dry. The right swim trunk for any body, in any body of water.

title: Reverse-weave Heavyweight Crewneck (Hasty Pudding HPT Pot Sweatshirt)
description:
Made in USA. 12 oz. reverse-weave heavyweight cotton.
The Hasty Pudding is one of Harvard's oldest student societies. The Pudding is best known for its annual comedy musical productions that tour New York and Bermuda each spring. Five presidents have been members (John Adams, John Quincy Adams, Theodore Roosevelt, FDR and JFK). More recent alums include Andy Borowitz (creator of The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air) and Rashida Jones. We tapped into their emblems and their tongue-in-cheek vintage illustrations - most of which feature the club's icons, the crocodile, sphinx, and pudding pot. The Pudding's sense of history and sense of irony complement the Rowing Blazers brand perfectly.
One size: large. Looks good on most!

description: We are very excited to have our new and improved driving shoe back in stock.Made by hand in Northern Italy using the finest supple calf leather, these are a thing of beauty that have to be experienced to be believed. Unlike a lot of drivers, these are carefully hand sewn to ensure the toe doesn't curl up at the end, making for a more elegant profile. Aim for a neat fit, this will ensure that your drivers feel like a pair of gloves for your feet and will mould to the profile of your foot over time.We have made very limited numbers so make sure you act quickly.Details and Care:- Genuine leather with rubber "tacchetti gommino" sole - Made in Italy- Spot clean with specific leather care products

title: 100% Cotton T-shirt (Oxford Brookes University Boat Club Short Sleeve Tee)
description:
100% cotton white tee with bulls head and red, white and navy horizontal stripes. Printed on the back with bulls head and Oxford Brookes victories.
We’ve partnered with two of Britain’s most successful and storied student rowing clubs: Imperial and Oxford Brookes. Last year’s Henley was a historic regatta for these two clubs, with Imperial taking the Wyfold Challenge Cup and Brookes taking a double win in the Temple Challenge Cup and the Ladies’ Challenge Plate. This year they are looking for victories again. We’re proud to work with these two clubs, and a portion of the proceeds from these items will go directly to support rowing at Imperial and Brookes.
Unisex. Runs true to size (men's sizes).

title: Off White on Navy Ari Print Swimmers
description: This print was inspired by an old photograph of Aristotle Onassis and one of his guests on the deck of his yacht, Christina O. Aristotle's guest was wearing an amazing printed shirt, and in honour of his host, we named this the Ari print. For these swimmers we chose a fabric with a peach finish, beautifully soft on the skin. We've added invisible side seam pockets, a handy back pocket with a zip to secure your personal things, and an internal coin pocket. We chose a soft netting for the lining, piped on the edges.  Details and care:- 100% Polyamide- Made in Portugal- Rinse after use, make sure garment is dry before storing- Gentle cold machine wash, do not dry clean- Do not iron, do not tumble dry

title: Stubbs & Wootton + Todd Snyder Camo Slippers
description:
We're happy to announce our partnership with Stubbs & Wooton!
Launched in 1993 in Palm Beach, Florida - Stubbs & Wootton instantly became recognized as classically elegant and fashion forward. Giving the slipper its due recognition as an all-purpose shoe, they are responsible for making evening slippers relevant once again.
Their name comes from 18th-century English artists, Mr. George Stubbs and Mr. John Wootton, both of who specialized in painting scenes of gentlemanly sporting whose influence is so fittingly tied to their eternal pursuit of elegance.
Brilliant with a tuxedo. Perfect with shorts, and everything in between, Stubb's European production ensures superior quality forever.

title: 100% Pima Cotton Polo (Authentic Polo Shirt with Satin Stripe - Black)
description:
100% pima cotton real piqué polo jersey with a genuine, hand-sewn diagonal satin stripe. Authentic, but also modern and uncomplicated.
Three-button placket (the good ol' fashioned way). Split tail. No logo on chest, because, come on, you either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing. 100% Peruvian pima cotton. Props not included.
Unisex (men's sizing). Classic / oversized fit. For a more fitted look, order one size down.
"This shirt is based on a vintage Yale polo jersey from the early 80s: it was beautiful. Navy blue soft pima cotton (no tech-y fabrics) with a hand-stitched white satin stripe - not too wide - running diagonally across the front. No one makes polo shirts like these (until now), and there's a reason why: it's not easy, because the pima cotton is a knit, and the satin is a woven. It has to be sewn by hand. But it's worthwhile, because the result is just right. I would never buy a pieced piqué diagonal stripe polo shirt; but this is a different animal altogether. You feel like Laddie Sanford, or like Steve McQueen in the Thomas Crown Affair. But it's also modern and uncomplicated. Our polos don't have any logo on the chest, because I like it that way; I either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing." - Jack

title: IAMWILD® Scosha Bracelet
description:
IAMWILD® is the brainchild of legendary photographer Roberto Dutesco, who began his career shooting fashion and has evolved his body of work into personal, passionate explorations of natural subjects, including, in his most famous series, the wild horses of Sable Island. Todd Snyder has partnered with the IAMWILD® Foundation to bring founder Roberto Dutesco’s artwork and mission to its Madison Square Park flagship. For a limited time, a selection of Dutesco’s photography — exploring nature, wildlife and environmental interests — will be on display and for sale alongside a curated assortment of books.
 Todd Snyder x IAMWILD® have co-created a capsule of Todd Snyder x IAMWILD® tees and hoodies based on signature styles, enabling customers to wear a message of awareness about environmental protection and global community while helping to fund important conservation work.
 25% of the sales from this collection will fund conservation causes through the IAMWILD® Foundation.
 This piece is crafted by Brooklyn based Scosha Jewelry.

November is RUGBY MONTH at Rowing Blazers. Our month-long tribute to the rugby shirt includes multiple drops, beginning with a delivery of David Hockney and Mick Jagger-inspired hoop-striped rugbies. The rugby shirt has its origins in traditional British sport, but it’s found its way into the menswear canon, where it commands serious respect in the diverse worlds of streetwear, prep, and “dad style.” We’re incredibly proud of the accolades our rugbies have earned, and we see ourselves as stewards of the rugby shirt tradition. Fellow rugby shirt devotees, take heart and stay tuned for more.

title: Busted-seam button-down shirt (Striped Distressed Oxford with Busted Seams)
description:
The perfect Oxford shirt with reverse ("busted") seams. Handmade and distressed in the U.S.A. 100% Japanese cotton Oxford cloth. Hand distressed collar and cuffs.
Enzyme washed for softness. Soft S-roll button down collar. Pure cotton buttons. American placket. Rowing Blazers sandpaper card included for additional at-home distressing. (Props not included.)
This shirt has a modern cut. Model is 5'11" and wears a Medium.
"I had an Oxford cloth button-down shirt that I practically lived in. I wore it while excavating in Italy; hiking in Patagonia; celebrating at Henley after exhilarating victories; drowning my sorrows at Henley after gutting losses; I wore it to elegant dinners and to many more greasy spoons. The collar and cuffs wore down and frayed with years of use, and seams started to come apart. And it just felt right. We've recreated that feeling -- without overdoing it, but also without kidding ourselves, with just the right amount of tongue-in-cheek. That's why we include a piece of sandpaper with each shirt, printed on the reverse with a withering quote by the great Edward Said about his Princeton roommates who used to sand the collars of their BDs." - Jack

We’ve partnered with two of Britain’s most successful and storied student rowing clubs: Imperial and Oxford Brookes. Last year’s Henley was a historic regatta for these two clubs, with Imperial taking the Wyfold Challenge Cup and Brookes taking a double win in the Temple Challenge Cup and the Ladies’ Challenge Plate. This year they are looking for victories again. We’re proud to work with these two clubs, and a portion of the proceeds from these items will go directly to support rowing at Imperial and Brookes.

title: Navy Brushed Superfine Cotton Utility Vest
description:
It's hard being a man sometimes, where do we put all our stuff when we're out and about? I'm not sold on carrying a man bag. I don't mind a backpack but when you need to return videotapes in a hurry they're annoying to take on and off, not to mention the damage they do to your jacket. This utility vest is the answer to all your problems. In 1905, the Welsh Dragons went undefeated and beat the New Zealand All Blacks in a legendary match; (they were the only team to beat the All Blacks in their 35-stop tour). Before the game, the All Blacks performed the famous Haka, and the 47,000-strong crowd answered with an impromptu but hearty rendition of the Welsh national anthem, ‘Land of our Fathers’. It was, allegedly, the first time a national anthem was sung before a sporting fixture.

The Hasty Pudding is one of Harvard's oldest student societies. The Pudding is best known for its annual comedy musical productions that tour New York and Bermuda each spring. Five presidents have been members (John Adams, John Quincy Adams, Theodore Roosevelt, FDR and JFK). More recent alums include Andy Borowitz (creator of The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air) and Rashida Jones. We tapped into their emblems and their tongue-in-cheek vintage illustrations - most of which feature the club's icons, the crocodile, sphinx, and pudding pot. The Pudding's sense of history and sense of irony complement the Rowing Blazers brand perfectly.

title: Wide-wale Corde-du-Roi Trousers (Dark Hunter Corduroy Trousers)
description:
100% cotton corduroy pants in Dark Hunter. Hand-tailored in New York.
Old school mid-rise. Hand-tailored trousers in extra soft, wide-wale Italian corduroy.
These pants are straight leg - our slightly more fitted cut. Pants are listed by waist size. Waist sizes 28-32 are 32 inches in length. Larger waist sizes are 34 inches in length. Roll 'em up or get 'em trimmed if needed!
"Corde-du-roi" ("cord of the king") is the mythical origin for the modern word "corduroy." In reality, the material originated as an industrial workwear fabric. We prefer the more regal connotation. And that's why, while most corduroy trousers - even the expensive ones - feel stiff and starchy, ours are super soft. Made from luxurious Italian wide-wale corduroy, our trousers are velvet-y enough to nap in. Hand-tailored in New York City and perfect for September-March.

title: 100% Pima Cotton Polo (Harry's New York Bar Polo)
description:
100% pima cotton real piqué polo jersey embroidered with Harry's famous bar flies motif. Made in Peru. Props not included.
Three-button placket (the good ol' fashioned way). Split tail. Harry's bar flies on chest. 100% Peruvian pima cotton. Props not included.
Unisex (men's sizing). Classic / oversized fit. For a more fitted look, order one size down.
Harry's is a legendary institution that made its mark in the worlds of literature, music, art, politics - and of course drinking. Established in 1911, Harry's New York Bar is the birthplace of the Bloody Mary, the Side Car, the French 75, and a long list of other iconic cocktails. The bar itself - decorated with wood panelling, foreign banknotes, the shields of Oxford and Cambridge colleges, and, most notably, vintage American collegiate banners and felt pennants - was a favorite watering hole for the likes of Jean-Paul Sartre, Ernest Hemingway, Rita Hayworth, Jack Dempsey, the Duke of Windsor, Thornton Wilder, Marlene Dietrich, Humphrey Bogart, and Coco Chanel. The Piano Room downstairs was frequented by Gershwin, who composed "An American in Paris" there. Harry's New York Bar continues to be a gathering place for intellectuals, celebrities, sportsmen and rakes. Many have been inducted into Harry's very own secret society, the International Bar Flies (or I.B.F.), whose icon - two cartoon flies - adorn the mirror behind the bar. To this day, Harry's is known for its limited menu: a wide variety of the best cocktails in Paris, and to eat... only hot dogs.

title: Stubbs & Wootton + Todd Snyder Black Velvet Slippers
description:
We're happy to announce our partnership with Stubbs & Wootten!
Launched in 1993 in Palm Beach, Florida - Stubbs & Wootton instantly became recognized as classically elegant and fashion forward. Giving the slipper its due recognition as an all-purpose shoe, they are responsible for making evening slippers relevant once again.
Their name comes from 18th-century English artists, Mr. George Stubbs and Mr. John Wootton, both of who specialized in painting scenes of gentlemanly sporting whose influence is so fittingly tied to their eternal pursuit of elegance.
Brilliant with a tuxedo. Perfect with shorts, and everything in between, Stubb's European production ensures superior quality forever.

title: 100% Pima Cotton Polo (Authentic Polo Shirt with Satin Stripe - Pink)
description:
100% pima cotton real piqué polo jersey with a genuine, hand-sewn diagonal satin stripe. Authentic, but also modern and uncomplicated.
Three-button placket (the good ol' fashioned way). Split tail. No logo on chest, because, come on, you either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing. 100% Peruvian pima cotton. Props not included.
Unisex (men's sizing). Classic / oversized fit. For a more fitted look, order one size down.
"This shirt is based on a vintage Yale polo jersey from the early 80s: it was beautiful. Navy blue soft pima cotton (no tech-y fabrics) with a hand-stitched white satin stripe - not too wide - running diagonally across the front. No one makes polo shirts like these (until now), and there's a reason why: it's not easy, because the pima cotton is a knit, and the satin is a woven. It has to be sewn by hand. But it's worthwhile, because the result is just right. I would never buy a pieced piqué diagonal stripe polo shirt; but this is a different animal altogether. You feel like Laddie Sanford, or like Steve McQueen in the Thomas Crown Affair. But it's also modern and uncomplicated. Our polos don't have any logo on the chest, because I like it that way; I either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing." - Jack

title: Grenson Declan Leather Chelsea Boot in Black
description:
Grenson has been making shoes since 1866. It takes up to 8 weeks to make a pair of shoes and involves over 200 individual steps. All of their shoes are “Goodyear Welted”. This is a shoemaking technique that was invented in the mid 1800’s; the main feature of Goodyear Welted shoes is that the upper is stitched to a leather band called a Welt and this is then stitched to the sole. It's key benefit is that the shoes are strong, last a long time and can be easily resoled.
The classic Chelsea Boot in Black Leather, a must have for this Fall.- Goodyear Welt.- Single Leather Sole.

title: Cotton Jersey Blazer (Purple Cotton Blazer with "Swelled Seam" Topstitch)
description:
Purple knit cotton jersey blazer with "swelled seam" topstitch. Handmade in New York. 100% American year-round heavyweight cotton jersey. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets.
Hidden rib cuff. Rib underarm gusset. “Henry” label under collar. Rowing Blazers house brass button. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Ventless.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long.
The original blazers were the hoodies of their day (warm-up jackets for Oxford and Cambridge rowers). We wanted to honor that heritage by creating a casual blazer in cotton jersey. We developed this premium American-knit French terry ourselves, and it couldn’t have come out better. But this isn’t a sweatshirt: each one is hand-tailored in the United States with a painstaking attention to detail. The most comfortable blazer a guy or girl can own.

title: Washed Twill Dad Hat (Drone Cap - Blue)
description:
Blue cotton twill dad hat with satin-stitched drone bee motif. 20% of the proceeds will be donated to the Honeybee Conservancy. Read more below.
At Rowing Blazers, the bee has been an important part of our brand since the beginning. We've made hats and ties with a carefully embroidered bee motif, and many of our blazers feature brass buttons adorned with bee and bee-hive motifs. Our double-breasted blazer is emblazoned with Latin proverb "Ubi mel ibi apes": "Where there is honey, there are bees." But bee populations are dying at an alarming rate. And these tiny creatures play a gigantic role in our creating and maintaining our food supply, the stability of our ecosystem, and biodiversity. So we've decided to partner with the Honeybee Conservancy, a non-profit established in response to the bee crisis. The Honeybee Conservancy engages in education and outreach; and supports bee research and builds bee habitats, while increasing access to organic, sustainable food in under-served communities. And for this week - and for the next month - we are donating 20% of our proceeds from all four of our bee hats and our bee tie to the Honeybee Conservancy. Help us help the Honeybees, and visit thehoneybeeconservancy.org to learn more about what you can do for these magnificent little creatures.
Adjustable. One size fits most.

Rowing Blazers is proud to sponsor the Harriman Cup: the annual Yale-Virginia polo match and fundraiser, contested for the past three decades in honor of diplomat, polo player and former New York Governor Averell Harriman. The annual Varsity Race in the Netherlands is one of the most historic, prestigious rowing events in the world and home to many of the sport’s greatest and most eccentric traditions. These include the naked swim out to the victorious crew; the traditional blazer-fights; and the post-race kroegjool festivities. This year marks the 135th Varsity. To celebrate, Rowing Blazers has made a special capsule collection co-branded with The Varsity using their historic Jutphaas emblem.

title: Shave Cream
description:
3.2 FL OZ | 100 ML 
The Blind Barber Shave Cream is a rich, warm, protective lather that acts as a cushion between your razor blade and your skin to prevent irritation and razor burn, leaving the skin exceptionally smooth and moisturized. The skin is softened and beard is lifted for a close and comfortable shave.
After daily cleansing and/or showering, apply a thin layer over wet skin and beard. Shave and rinse well. Repeat as often as necessary (think: dates, in-laws, work, etc.). Parabens, sulfates, or artificial dyes? Never. Handsome? Always.

title: 100% Cotton T-Shirt (Harry's New York Bar Short Sleeve Tee)
description:
100% cotton short sleeve tee printed with Harry's address on the back and map to Harry's on the front chest. Printed in USA. Props not included.
Harry's is a legendary institution that made its mark in the worlds of literature, music, art, politics - and of course drinking. Established in 1911, Harry's New York Bar is the birthplace of the Bloody Mary, the Side Car, the French 75, and a long list of other iconic cocktails. The bar itself - decorated with wood panelling, foreign banknotes, the shields of Oxford and Cambridge colleges, and, most notably, vintage American collegiate banners and felt pennants - was a favorite watering hole for the likes of Jean-Paul Sartre, Ernest Hemingway, Rita Hayworth, Jack Dempsey, the Duke of Windsor, Thornton Wilder, Marlene Dietrich, Humphrey Bogart, and Coco Chanel. The Piano Room downstairs was frequented by Gershwin, who composed "An American in Paris" there. Harry's New York Bar continues to be a gathering place for intellectuals, celebrities, sportsmen and rakes. Many have been inducted into Harry's very own secret society, the International Bar Flies (or I.B.F.), whose icon - two cartoon flies - adorn the mirror behind the bar. To this day, Harry's is known for its limited menu: a wide variety of the best cocktails in Paris, and to eat... only hot dogs.
Unisex. Runs true to size (men's sizes).

title: Corduroy Dad Hat (Oxford Brookes University Boat Club Cap)
description:
Burgundy corduroy dad hat with hand-embroidered gold Oxford Brookes bulls head.
We’ve partnered with two of Britain’s most successful and storied student rowing clubs: Imperial and Oxford Brookes. Last year’s Henley was a historic regatta for these two clubs, with Imperial taking the Wyfold Challenge Cup and Brookes taking a double win in the Temple Challenge Cup and the Ladies’ Challenge Plate. This year they are looking for victories again. We’re proud to work with these two clubs, and a portion of the proceeds from these items will go directly to support rowing at Imperial and Brookes.
Adjustable. One size fits most.

title: Super Heavyweight Rugby by Sports D'Epoque (Birkenhead authentic heavyweight rugby)
description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) horizontal-striped rugby jersey. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; three-button placket.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
So far, most of our rugbies have been recreations of really old-school international rugby jerseys; and most of these are solid colors, with oversized, intricate embroidery. But I do also love a good old-fashioned hoop stripe rugby shirt. Of course, to introduce these into our collection, I wasn't going to just pick any old random colors for the stripes. I went to a framed print that hangs next to my desk -- a chart from The Boy's Own Paper 1922 called "Some Famous Rugby Football Jerseys." Two caught my eye in particular, and they happen to be the colors of two of the oldest rugby clubs in the world: Richmond F.C. and Birkenhead Park F.C. Birkenhead Park was founded in 1871, the same year as the Rugby Football Union (the first governing body for "rugby-rules football"). Their red-white-blue-white pattern is so old, but looks so modern. Richmond began as a soccer club, but was one of the founding members of the Rugby Football Union. Their black-red-gold colors were chosen on a whim in the 1860s and inspired by a Belgian army detachment training in London at the time. We're obsessed with the history and the stories behind the clothes, so this is the perfect way for us to introduce hoop-striped rugbies into our collection.

title: Row New York Extra Large Beach Bag (Manhattan Heavy Duty Beach Bag - Noah x Rowing Blazers)
description:
Part of a limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Noah, in support of Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. The program serves over 4000 kids from all five boroughs, mostly from the city's under-resourced communities. American-made heavy-duty purple canvas tote bag with embroidered Manhattan borough patch. 100% cotton.
Heavy-duty cotton canvas. Limited edition. Made in the U.S.A.
15% of all sales will go directly to Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. Both Rowing Blazers and Noah are NYC-based brands, and it means a lot to both to be able to partner with a program that has a direct impact on the community in which they create. 100% of kids at Row New York graduate high school and 99% go on to college; 100% exceed the CDC's recommended daily activity levels. Needless to say, these are much higher than city averages. 84% of participants row for free, and 53% come from families with a household income under $30,000. Over half will become first generation college students.

title: Distressed cotton blazer (Destroyed "X" Blazer in Light Blue Cotton Twill)
description:
The destroyed version of our cotton twill blazer, in the style of the jackets worn at the annual Dutch Varsity regatta. This jacket features raw edges at the lapel notch and around the chest pocket, and it is enzyme washed to make it extra soft. It's also machine-washable.
Hand tailored in New York. 3-roll-2 silhouette. 100% cotton. Three patch pockets. Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Machine washable. Cross-stitched Latin proverb ("O Tempora! O Mores!") under lapel. Props not included.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long. Model is 6'0" and wears a 40.
We took our signature blazer fit and construction and rendered it in a rugged light blue cotton twill, in the style of the cotton jackets worn at the annual Dutch Varsity regatta - where student rowers famously engage in semi-organized fights, grabbing each other by the lapels and trying to wrestle each other to the ground. Then we subtly destroyed it with raw edges on the lapel notches and around the edge of the chest pocket, and enzyme washed it to give it a soft, lived-in feel. Machine washable.

title: Champion Reverse Weave Contrast Sweatshirt in Dark Driftwood
description: Dreamed up by American coaches of the 1950s to keep their team’s uniforms in top shape, and developed by Champion, Reverse Weave is a pre-WWII technological marvel that continues to outperform the competition today. We brought this classic back from the archives and refreshed it in seasonal neutrals with contrast detailing at the cuffs. This brushed fleece style is cut on the cross-grain for a vintage look that resists shrinkage, with dual side panels for full range of motion and heat-dispersing contrast cuffs, collar and hem. Softly tailored for a slim fit in our Toronto factory, and exclusively designed, manufactured and distributed by Todd Snyder.

title: 100% Cotton T-Shirt (Hasty Pudding Bermuda Tee)
description:
100% Cotton T-shirt.
The Hasty Pudding is one of Harvard's oldest student societies. The Pudding is best known for its annual comedy musical productions that tour New York and Bermuda each spring. Five presidents have been members (John Adams, John Quincy Adams, Theodore Roosevelt, FDR and JFK). More recent alums include Andy Borowitz (creator of The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air) and Rashida Jones. We tapped into their emblems and their tongue-in-cheek vintage illustrations - most of which feature the club's icons, the crocodile, sphinx, and pudding pot. The Pudding's sense of history and sense of irony complement the Rowing Blazers brand perfectly.
Unisex. Runs true to size (men's sizes).

The Hasty Pudding is one of Harvard's oldest student societies. The Pudding is best known for its annual comedy musical productions that tour New York and Bermuda each spring. Five presidents have been members (John Adams, John Quincy Adams, Theodore Roosevelt, FDR and JFK). More recent alums include Andy Borowitz (creator of The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air) and Rashida Jones. We tapped into their emblems and their tongue-in-cheek vintage illustrations - most of which feature the club's icons, the crocodile, sphinx, and pudding pot. The Pudding's sense of history and sense of irony complement the Rowing Blazers brand perfectly.

Rowing Blazers is proud to sponsor the Harriman Cup: the annual polo match and fundraiser, contested for the past three decades in honor of diplomat, polo player and former New York Governor Averell Harriman. A non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the sport of polo, the Harriman Cup has raised over $1 million since its inception. This year's match will be held on September 16 at Bethpage State Park, Long Island. Rowing Blazers is proud to produce the official Harriman Cup team jerseys, blazers and the Rowing Blazers x Harriman Cup capsule.

title: Wide-wale Corde-du-Roi Jacket (Royal Blue Corduroy Jacket)
description:
Extra soft, wide-wale Italian corduroy jacket, hand-tailored in New York. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets. Hidden cross-stitched proverb ("O Tempora! O Mores!") under lapel.
Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. House brass buttons. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Props not included.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long. Model is 6'0" and wears a 40.
"Corde-du-roi" ("cord of the king") is the mythical origin for the modern word "corduroy." In reality, the material originated as an industrial workwear fabric. We prefer the more regal connotation. And that's why, while most corduroy jackets - even the expensive ones - feel stiff and starchy, ours is super soft. Made from luxurious Italian wide-wale corduroy, our jacket is velvet-y enough to nap in. Hand-tailored in New York City with a Latin proverb (Cicero's "O Tempora! O Mores!") stitched under the lapel, this jacket is fit for a king. It's unlined in the back and perfect for September-March.

title: Grenson Declan Suede Chelsea Boot in Chocolate
description:
Grenson has been making shoes since 1866. It takes up to 8 weeks to make a pair of shoes and involves over 200 individual steps. All of their shoes are “Goodyear Welted”. This is a shoemaking technique that was invented in the mid 1800’s; the main feature of Goodyear Welted shoes is that the upper is stitched to a leather band called a Welt and this is then stitched to the sole. It's key benefit is that the shoes are strong, last a long time and can be easily resoled.
The classic Chelsea Boot in Chocolate Suede, a must have for this Fall.- Goodyear Welt.- Single Leather Sole.

description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) bottle-green rugby jersey embroidered with Harry's famous bar flies motif. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible. Props not included.
Rugby collar; three-button placket; gorgeous rib knit cuffs. Props not included.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
Harry's is a legendary institution that made its mark in the worlds of literature, music, art, politics - and of course drinking. Established in 1911, Harry's New York Bar is the birthplace of the Bloody Mary, the Side Car, the French 75, and a long list of other iconic cocktails. The bar itself - decorated with wood panelling, foreign banknotes, the shields of Oxford and Cambridge colleges, and, most notably, vintage American collegiate banners and felt pennants - was a favorite watering hole for the likes of Jean-Paul Sartre, Ernest Hemingway, Rita Hayworth, Jack Dempsey, the Duke of Windsor, Thornton Wilder, Marlene Dietrich, Humphrey Bogart, and Coco Chanel. The Piano Room downstairs was frequented by Gershwin, who composed "An American in Paris" there. Harry's New York Bar continues to be a gathering place for intellectuals, celebrities, sportsmen and rakes. Many have been inducted into Harry's very own secret society, the International Bar Flies (or I.B.F.), whose icon - two cartoon flies - adorn the mirror behind the bar. To this day, Harry's is known for its limited menu: a wide variety of the best cocktails in Paris, and to eat... only hot dogs.

title: 3-roll-2 single breasted blazer (Navy stripe blazer)
description:
Navy blazer with Baltic blue and cream stripes. Handmade in New York. 75% wool 25% cotton flannel from Scotland. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets.
Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. Cross-stitched Latin motto TERRA MARIQVE under lapel. Rowing Blazers house button in brass, made in Connecticut. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Props not included.
This blazer has a modern cut and runs a little more snugly than most of our other blazers because of the hefty material. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 come in both regular and long. Model is 5'11" and wears a 40.
"I wanted to create an authentic, striped rowing blazer that was also eminently wearable. I also wanted to incorporate the color of the club with which I won Henley Royal Regatta in 2013: Baltic blue. As luck would have it, the shade looks brilliant with navy and cream. In the course of creating my book and accumulating my collection of vintage blazers, I realized there are certain ratios that look best when it comes to the width of the stripes. I think we got it just right on this one. We worked with a very historic mill in Scotland to produce the pattern in a heavyweight wool-cotton flannel. Under the lapel is the Latin phrase TERRA MARIQVE, “On land and sea,” a reference to the origins of the blazer as a practical jacket to be worn in rowing boats while training and racing, and its rapid adoption for use on terra firma, where, by the mid-19th century it was already a staple of the gentleman’s wardrobe." - Jack

Rowing Blazers founder Jack Carlson grew up in Cambridge, Mass., and bought his first Shaggy Dog sweater from J. title: Row New York Hooded Sweatshirt (Manhattan Hoodie - Noah x Rowing Blazers)
description:
Part of a limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Noah, in support of Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. The program serves over 4000 kids from all five boroughs, mostly from the city's under-resourced communities. Purple hoodie with Manhattan embroidery on the left sleeve. 100% cotton.
Embroidered Rowing Blazers logo on hood; limited edition Noah core logo with oars on front; borough embroidery on sleeve, and Latin motto ("Destitutus ventis remos adhibe," "If the wind will not serve, take to the oars" on cuff). Made in Canada.
This hoodie fits true to size (men's sizing). For a more relaxed fit, order one size up. Unisex.
15% of all sales will go directly to Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. Both Rowing Blazers and Noah are NYC-based brands, and it means a lot to both to be able to partner with a program that has a direct impact on the community in which they create. 100% of kids at Row New York graduate high school and 99% go on to college; 100% exceed the CDC's recommended daily activity levels. Needless to say, these are much higher than city averages. 84% of participants row for free, and 53% come from families with a household income under $30,000. Over half will become first generation college students.

title: Japanese Wool Necktie (Drones Club Tie)
description:
Handmade in New York. 100% Japanese wool. Single embroidered drone bee motif. "Tipsy" Latin address label on back. 20% of the proceeds will be donated to the Honeybee Conservancy. Read more below.
One size. 2 7/8 inches wide.
"This tie is inspired by a combination of things: the Drones Club of Jeeves & Wooster; the Wu-Tang swarm; and the Rushmore Beekeepers." - Jack
At Rowing Blazers, the bee has been an important part of our brand since the beginning. We've made hats and ties with a carefully embroidered bee motif, and many of our blazers feature brass buttons adorned with bee and bee-hive motifs. Our double-breasted blazer is emblazoned with Latin proverb "Ubi mel ibi apes": "Where there is honey, there are bees." But bee populations are dying at an alarming rate. And these tiny creatures play a gigantic role in our creating and maintaining our food supply, the stability of our ecosystem, and biodiversity. So we've decided to partner with the Honeybee Conservancy, a non-profit established in response to the bee crisis. The Honeybee Conservancy engages in education and outreach; and supports bee research and builds bee habitats, while increasing access to organic, sustainable food in under-served communities. And for this week - and for the next month - we are donating 20% of our proceeds from all four of our bee hats and our bee tie to the Honeybee Conservancy. Help us help the Honeybees, and visit thehoneybeeconservancy.org to learn more about what you can do for these magnificent little creatures.

title: Super Heavyweight Rugby by Sports D'Epoque (Argyll & Sutherland Highlanders authentic heavyweight rugby)
description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) rugby jersey with green, red, navy and yellow horizontal stripes. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; three-button placket; gorgeous rib knit cuffs.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
The Argyll & Sutherland Highlanders stripe is one of the world’s most recognizable regimental patterns. It made its way from the Scottish Highlands to the United States where ties in the stripe are worn by would-be professors and menswear nerds from coast to coast (and where it is erroneously misspelled “Argyle”). We don’t love the tie - unless you served in the Thin Red Line - but we love the pattern itself when it’s blown up.

title: Row New York Sweatpants (The Bronx Sweatpants - Noah x Rowing Blazers)
description:
Part of a limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Noah, in support of Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. The program serves over 4000 kids from all five boroughs, mostly from the city's under-resourced communities. Navy sweatpants with The Bronx embroidery on the left leg. 100% cotton.
Limited edition Noah core logo with oars on back; borough embroidery on left leg. Made in Canada.
These sweatpants fit true to size (men's sizing). Unisex.
15% of all sales will go directly to Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. Both Rowing Blazers and Noah are NYC-based brands, and it means a lot to both to be able to partner with a program that has a direct impact on the community in which they create. 100% of kids at Row New York graduate high school and 99% go on to college; 100% exceed the CDC's recommended daily activity levels. Needless to say, these are much higher than city averages. 84% of participants row for free, and 53% come from families with a household income under $30,000. Over half will become first generation college students.

title: Shetland wool sweater (Shaggy Dog Sweater - Pink)
description:
100% Shetland wool sweater in pink featuring an oversized version of the vintage Shaggy Dog label on the chest. Made in Scotland. Part of a limited edition Rowing Blazers x J.Press collaboration.
100% Shetland wool. Made in Scotland.
This sweater is made in J.Press' original wide-body 'dad fit'.
Rowing Blazers founder Jack Carlson grew up in Cambridge, Mass., and bought his first Shaggy Dog sweater from J. Press in Harvard Square when he was in high school. “We don’t make sweaters at Rowing Blazers, and the Shaggy Dog is not only a J. Press icon, but it’s a staple of traditional American menswear period,” he said. “I love the vintage label on my old Shaggy Dog sweater, with the little drawing of the dog. It was a natural fit to collaborate and put a tongue-in-cheek spin on the Shaggy Dog sweater.”

title: Japanese Wool Necktie (Luke Edward Hall Discus Thrower Tie)
description:
Handmade in New York. 100% Japanese wool. Single embroidered Luke Edward Hall discus thrower.
One size. 2 7/8 inches wide.
London-based artist Luke Edward Hall and Rowing Blazers founder Jack Carlson share a love for the Classical world. In Luke’s case, it’s an aesthetic fascination: the architecture of Greco-Roman temples, and the human and divine body in sculpture. For Jack, it’s an academic pursuit: before establishing the New York-based menswear brand in 2017, he was a field archaeologist in Italy and earned a PhD in Roman archaeology at Oxford. The two met in 2014 when Jack’s book – also called Rowing Blazers – was published. But they reconnected when Rowing Blazers launched as a brand, and the idea of a collaboration came naturally to both of them. The capsule is based on a series of five illustrations by Luke Edward Hall inspired by the ancient world: a Greek vase; the mask of Tutankhamun; a discus-thrower; a set of ionic columns in ruin; and a statue bust.

title: Corduroy Dad Hat (Hasty Pudding Sphinx Cap - Green)
description:
Dark green corduroy dad hat with hand-embroidered sphinx.
The Hasty Pudding is one of Harvard's oldest student societies. The Pudding is best known for its annual comedy musical productions that tour New York and Bermuda each spring. Five presidents have been members (John Adams, John Quincy Adams, Theodore Roosevelt, FDR and JFK). More recent alums include Andy Borowitz (creator of The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air) and Rashida Jones. We tapped into their emblems and their tongue-in-cheek vintage illustrations - most of which feature the club's icons, the crocodile, sphinx, and pudding pot. The Pudding's sense of history and sense of irony complement the Rowing Blazers brand perfectly.
Adjustable. One size fits most.

title: Corgi Solid Forest Green Dress Socks
description: Corgi was founded in 1892 by draper Rhys Jones who after purchasing some second-hand knitting machines, began to produce thigh-high woolen stockings for the local colliers. Over time he began to produce a range of finer quality socks. And begin a rich history of producing hand-knitted wool, cotton and cashmere socks a process of which continues on today with his great, great grandchildren at the helm. These socks are a wool, and nylon blend constructed with a ribbed knit to ensure a snugger fit.

title: Beard Replenishment Oil
description:
1 FL OZ | 30 ML 

Blind Barber’s Beard Replenishment Oil is a careful combination of essential oils designed to moisturize and soften coarse beard hairs as well as the skin underneath.  This lightweight and aromatic oil leaves a “clean feel” and a soft touch whether you are clean-shaven or fully bearded. Either way, it’s time to nuzzle up.  

To use, simply apply a few drops to your palm, rub between hands and apply to desired areas of beard.  Be sure to massage into the beard to allow hair follicles and skin beneath to soak up the rejuvenating oil.

description:
Rowing Blazers. Signed by Jack Carlson. Hardcover, first U.S. (red) edition. 256 pages. Ships separately. Please allow an additional 7-10 days for delivery.
Rowing Blazers looks at the striped, piped, trimmed and badged blazers that are still worn by oarsmen and oarswomen around the world, and at the rituals, elite athletes, prestigious clubs and legendary races associated with them.
"Right up there with Take Ivy."— Kempt "Unapologetically cool and crisp."— Complex "Lush... Artfully photographed."— Vanity Fair "Top 20 best fashion books."— Elle "Carlson's book is the perfect addition to your coffee table. Or, if you're like some of the guys in the pages, your stately library."— GQ "Handsome ... glorious ... Carlson is an affable, elegant guide to the traditions and eccentricities of the rowing fraternity."— The Rake "Rowing Blazers by Jack Carlson is a captivating and beautifully illustrated celebration of this eccentric but wonderful tradition."— Five time Olympic Gold Medalist Sir Steve Redgrave "If you haven't done so already, run, don't walk, and get your copy of Rowing Blazers by Jack Carlson, a simply beautiful ode to the halcyon days of rowing teams and their colorful boating attire. This is one book you simply must own!"— Jeffrey Banks, author of Preppy "Jack Carlson’s monumental book takes readers inside this extraordinary world, steeped in history and heritage."— Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss

title: Corduroy Dad Hat (Drone Cap - Tan)
description:
Tan corduroy dad hat with satin-stitched drone bee motif. 20% of the proceeds will be donated to the Honeybee Conservancy. Read more below.
At Rowing Blazers, the bee has been an important part of our brand since the beginning. We've made hats and ties with a carefully embroidered bee motif, and many of our blazers feature brass buttons adorned with bee and bee-hive motifs. Our double-breasted blazer is emblazoned with Latin proverb "Ubi mel ibi apes": "Where there is honey, there are bees." But bee populations are dying at an alarming rate. And these tiny creatures play a gigantic role in our creating and maintaining our food supply, the stability of our ecosystem, and biodiversity. So we've decided to partner with the Honeybee Conservancy, a non-profit established in response to the bee crisis. The Honeybee Conservancy engages in education and outreach; and supports bee research and builds bee habitats, while increasing access to organic, sustainable food in under-served communities. And for this week - and for the next month - we are donating 20% of our proceeds from all four of our bee hats and our bee tie to the Honeybee Conservancy. Help us help the Honeybees, and visit thehoneybeeconservancy.org to learn more about what you can do for these magnificent little creatures.
Adjustable. One size fits most.

title: 3-roll-2 single breasted blazer (Navy flannel blazer with "swelled seam" topstitch)
description:
The perfect blue blazer. Handmade in New York. 100% year-round wool flannel. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets. Top-stitched "swelled seam" edges and pockets.
One vintage/secondhand lapel pin from our archive, and our handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. Cross-stitched Latin motto AVT VIAM INVENIAM AVT FACIAM under lapel. Rowing Blazers house button in brass, made in Connecticut. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Props not included.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long. Model is 5'11" and wears a 40.
"I wanted to create the perfect navy blazer; the blazer I always wanted, and the blazer every man deserves to have. This is our most understated blazer, but it still reflects our aesthetic and character. The three-roll-two silhouette, ventless back, flannel finish: these are qualities a proper blazer is supposed to have. Many have forgotten, but we shall remind them! Details like the single cuff buttons; the vitreous enamel buttonhole badge; and the hidden, cross-stitched motto (which translates to 'I shall either find a way, or make a way,' erroneously attributed to Hannibal, as he led his elephant cavalry over the Alps) are subtle, crispy and cryptic." - Jack

title: Super Heavyweight Rugby by Sports D'Epoque (New Zealand Rugby League authentic heavyweight rugby)
description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) black rugby jersey with white inverted chevron double "V" stripes and white embroidered fern. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; three-button placket; gorgeous rib knit cuffs.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
In 1895, the sport of rugby split into two codes: the traditional “Rugby Union” and the more working-class “Rugby League.” Over time, the rules of the two codes developed and diverged, and today Rugby League is a fast-paced version of the game popular in northern England, Australia, and New Zealand. While traditional Rugby Union jerseys are either solid colors or horizontal stripes, Rugby League jerseys traditionally use an inverted chevron “V” pattern, ironically invoking the design of a traditional cricket or tennis sweater.

title: 100% Pima Cotton Polo (Authentic Polo Shirt with Satin Stripe - Red)
description:
100% pima cotton real piqué polo jersey with a genuine, hand-sewn diagonal satin stripe. Authentic, but also modern and uncomplicated.
Three-button placket (the good ol' fashioned way). Split tail. No logo on chest, because, come on, you either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing. 100% Peruvian pima cotton. Props not included.
Unisex (men's sizing). Classic / oversized fit. For a more fitted look, order one size down.
"This shirt is based on a vintage Yale polo jersey from the early 80s: it was beautiful. Navy blue soft pima cotton (no tech-y fabrics) with a hand-stitched white satin stripe - not too wide - running diagonally across the front. No one makes polo shirts like these (until now), and there's a reason why: it's not easy, because the pima cotton is a knit, and the satin is a woven. It has to be sewn by hand. But it's worthwhile, because the result is just right. I would never buy a pieced piqué diagonal stripe polo shirt; but this is a different animal altogether. You feel like Laddie Sanford, or like Steve McQueen in the Thomas Crown Affair. But it's also modern and uncomplicated. Our polos don't have any logo on the chest, because I like it that way; I either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing." - Jack

title: 3-roll-2 single breasted blazer (Black blazer with black trim)
description:
Black blazer with black grosgrain trim. Handmade in New York. 100% year-round wool flannel. 3-roll-2 silhouette. Three patch pockets. Black grosgrain trim on edge of blazer and top edge of pockets.
Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. Cross-stitched Latin motto PECVNIA NON OLET under lapel. Bee button in brass, struck from vintage die in Connecticut. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Props not included.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long. Model is 5'11" and wears a 40.
“Like the court liveries and heraldic devices of medieval Europe, the street gang colors of Compton, and the patches and badges of Boy Scouts and Hell’s Angels, rowing blazers are tribal totems. The black-and-black blazer is a nod to some of these other subcultures and milieus; a subtle, urban variation on the traditional blazer; and a rakish evening jacket all at the same time. Looks dope with a hoodie; or a tuxedo shirt; or camo; or just about anything else. Handmade vitreous enamel cloisonné badge included; the hidden stitching under the lapel is a quote by the Emperor Vespasian. When his son Titus voiced an objection to a new tax on Rome’s public urinals, the emperor reached into a bag of coins and held a handful of aurei and denarii under his son’s nose. ‘PECUNIA NON OLET,’ he said. ‘The money doesn’t smell.’" - Jack

title: Wall Street Duffle Bag (Pierce & Pierce Banker Bag)
description:
Hand crafted in Connecticut from 18 oz. canvas with a water-resistant finish.
17" long and 10" deep. The straps are emblazoned with the corporate logo of Pierce & Pierce Mergers and Acquisitions: the fictional firm of Patrick Bateman in American Psycho and Sherman McCoy in Bonfire of the Vanities.
The banker bag - the little navy canvas duffle emblazoned with investment bank logos on its webbed cotton straps - is a New York icon. For some, it’s a badge of honor. For others, it’s a token of unearned privilege. But whether you’ve protested Wall Street bailouts or just passed your Series 7, we can all agree that these little bags are so square that they’re hip. More than that, they’re the perfect size; deceptively simple; convenient and well-built. Isn’t it time there was a banker bag for the masses? Rowing Blazers partnered with Warden Brooks, the mother-daughter owned company that has made the authentic Wall Street Duffle since 1978, to produce a banker bag we can all enjoy. Just like the canvas bags Warden Brooks makes for the like of Goldman, Merrill, and the New York Stock Exchange, this one is hand crafted in Connecticut from 18 oz. canvas with a water-resistant finish. The 80s are back, and this is the perfect bag for returning lots of videotapes.

title: Wide-wale Corde-du-Roi Trousers (Royal Blue Corduroy Trousers)
description:
100% cotton corduroy pants in Royal Blue. Hand-tailored in New York.
Old school mid-rise. Hand-tailored trousers in extra soft, wide-wale Italian corduroy.
These pants are straight leg - our slightly more fitted cut. Pants are listed by waist size. Waist sizes 28-32 are 32 inches in length. Larger waist sizes are 34 inches in length. Roll 'em up or get 'em trimmed if needed!
"Corde-du-roi" ("cord of the king") is the mythical origin for the modern word "corduroy." In reality, the material originated as an industrial workwear fabric. We prefer the more regal connotation. And that's why, while most corduroy trousers - even the expensive ones - feel stiff and starchy, ours are super soft. Made from luxurious Italian wide-wale corduroy, our trousers are velvet-y enough to nap in. Hand-tailored in New York City and perfect for September-March.

In 1895, the sport of rugby split into two codes: the traditional “Rugby Union” and the more working-class “Rugby League.” Over time, the rules of the two codes developed and diverged, and today Rugby League is a fast-paced version of the game popular in northern England, Australia, and New Zealand.While traditional Rugby Union jerseys are either solid colors or horizontal stripes, Rugby League jerseys traditionally use an inverted chevron “V” pattern, ironically invoking the design of a traditional cricket or tennis sweater

description:
The perfect Oxford shirt. Handmade and distressed in the U.S.A. 100% Japanese cotton Oxford cloth. Hand distressed collar and cuffs.

"I used to hate button-down collar shirts. But that’s because most in the market had short, flat, little collars and were made of cheap material. Then I discovered vintage button-downs, with their perfectly imperfect collar rolls and soft and heavy-duty, textured Oxford cloth. This is the perfect S-roll collar button-down shirt, made in the U.S.A., featuring light distressing on the collar and cuff, and enzyme washed for extra softness." - Jack

"Oarsmen often repurpose boat straps – used to secure rowing shells on transport trailers – for belts. Ours is a more rugged, heavy-duty variation, with a distressed nickel cam buckle and a cross-stitched Latin motto. And unlike leather belts, no animals died in the making of this belt." - Jack

November is RUGBY MONTH at Rowing Blazers. Our month-long tribute to the rugby shirt includes multiple drops, beginning with a delivery of David Hockney and Mick Jagger-inspired hoop-striped rugbies. The rugby shirt has its origins in traditional British sport, but it’s found its way into the menswear canon, where it commands serious respect in the diverse worlds of streetwear, prep, and “dad style.” We’re incredibly proud of the accolades our rugbies have earned, and we see ourselves as stewards of the rugby shirt tradition. Fellow rugby shirt devotees, take heart and stay tuned for more.

title: Wind Vintage (Rolex Day-Date 1803 with COSC Papers)
description: The Rolex Day-Date reference 1803 dates to circa 1967 and includes its chronometer certificate (a.k.a. "COSC papers") and an extremely rare "The Day-Date" promotional booklet. The dial is beautifully preserved and the case is crisp and full. Wind Vintage purchased this watch from Heritage Auctions in April for $8,437.50, just so there is full transparency on its origin and what was paid. It is understood that the consignor to the auction was the original owner. This watch is currently on view at the Rowing Blazers Clubhouse at 161 Grand Street in New York City. Curated by Wind Vintage. Ships separately. Please allow an additional 7-10 days for delivery. Contact eric@windvintage.com for inquiries.

In December 1870, five Scottish football clubs invited English footballers to participate in a match played by the “Rugby Rules." A team from Blackheath accepted on behalf of England, and the first international rugby match was played on March 27th, 1871, at Raeburn Palace. Scotland won with a goal and a try to only one try by England. The first international try was scored by Angus Buchanan, and converted by W. Cross.

title: Corduroy Dad Hat (Drone Cap - Burgundy)
description:
Burgundy corduroy dad hat with satin-stitched drone bee motif. 20% of the proceeds will be donated to The Honeybee Conservancy. Read more below.
At Rowing Blazers, the bee has been an important part of our brand since the beginning. We've made hats and ties with a carefully embroidered bee motif, and many of our blazers feature brass buttons adorned with bee and bee-hive motifs. Our double-breasted blazer is emblazoned with Latin proverb "Ubi mel ibi apes": "Where there is honey, there are bees." But bee populations are dying at an alarming rate. And these tiny creatures play a gigantic role in our creating and maintaining our food supply, the stability of our ecosystem, and biodiversity. So we've decided to partner with the Honeybee Conservancy, a non-profit established in response to the bee crisis. The Honeybee Conservancy engages in education and outreach; and supports bee research and builds bee habitats, while increasing access to organic, sustainable food in under-served communities. And for this week - and for the next month - we are donating 20% of our proceeds from all four of our bee hats and our bee tie to the Honeybee Conservancy. Help us help the Honeybees, and visit thehoneybeeconservancy.org to learn more about what you can do for these magnificent little creatures.
Adjustable. One size fits most.

title: 100% Cotton T-Shirt (Harry's New York Bar Long Sleeve Tee)
description:
100% cotton long sleeve tee printed with Harry's address on the front chest and Harry's famous bar flies motif on the sleeves. Printed in USA. Props not included.
Harry's is a legendary institution that made its mark in the worlds of literature, music, art, politics - and of course drinking. Established in 1911, Harry's New York Bar is the birthplace of the Bloody Mary, the Side Car, the French 75, and a long list of other iconic cocktails. The bar itself - decorated with wood panelling, foreign banknotes, the shields of Oxford and Cambridge colleges, and, most notably, vintage American collegiate banners and felt pennants - was a favorite watering hole for the likes of Jean-Paul Sartre, Ernest Hemingway, Rita Hayworth, Jack Dempsey, the Duke of Windsor, Thornton Wilder, Marlene Dietrich, Humphrey Bogart, and Coco Chanel. The Piano Room downstairs was frequented by Gershwin, who composed "An American in Paris" there. Harry's New York Bar continues to be a gathering place for intellectuals, celebrities, sportsmen and rakes. Many have been inducted into Harry's very own secret society, the International Bar Flies (or I.B.F.), whose icon - two cartoon flies - adorn the mirror behind the bar. To this day, Harry's is known for its limited menu: a wide variety of the best cocktails in Paris, and to eat... only hot dogs.
Unisex. Runs true to size (men's sizes).

Hidden rib cuff. Rib underarm gusset. “Henry” label under collar. Rowing Blazers house brass button. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Ventless.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long. Model is 5'9" and wears a 40.
The original blazers were the hoodies of their day (warm-up jackets for Oxford and Cambridge rowers). We wanted to honor that heritage by creating a casual blazer in cotton jersey. We developed this premium American-knit French terry ourselves, and it couldn’t have come out better. But this isn’t a sweatshirt: each one is hand-tailored in the United States with a painstaking attention to detail. The most comfortable blazer a guy or girl can own.

title: Handmade Super Heavyweight 12-Gauge Rugby by Sports D'Epoque (The Original Rugby Shirt)
description:
This rugby is currently being made in size L and XL and is available for PREORDER. Please allow an extra 7-10 days for shipping. This is the original rugby jersey. Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) white and red striped rugby jersey with satin-stitch embroidered skull and crossbones. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Working button cuffs. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; three-button placket. Working cuff buttons.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
According to legend, the game of rugby originated at Rugby School in England in during a game of soccer (football) in 1823. The story goes that one of the boys, William Webb Ellis, caught the ball and simply ran with it in his arms to the opposing goal. The sport was institutionalized with a firm set of rules for the first time in 1845 under the auspices of the famous Thomas Arnold, then-headmaster of Rugby School, who believed that teamwork and rivalry were paramount. He also instituted the House system at Rugby, with "School House" and "Town" as the two main rugby sides (for boarders and day students) within the school. The School House jersey featured an embroidered skull and bones motif, perhaps in reference to the more violent nature of the school's particular brand of football. We've recreated the Rugby School House shirt with obsessive accuracy (ours is based on an 1860 jersey), down to the band collar, all white placket, and working cuff buttons.

title: Row New York Extra Large Beach Bag (The Bronx Heavy Duty Beach Bag - Noah x Rowing Blazers)
description:
Part of a limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Noah, in support of Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. The program serves over 4000 kids from all five boroughs, mostly from the city's under-resourced communities. American-made heavy-duty navy canvas tote bag with embroidered The Bronx borough patch. 100% cotton.
Heavy-duty cotton canvas. Limited edition. Made in the U.S.A.
15% of all sales will go directly to Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. Both Rowing Blazers and Noah are NYC-based brands, and it means a lot to both to be able to partner with a program that has a direct impact on the community in which they create. 100% of kids at Row New York graduate high school and 99% go on to college; 100% exceed the CDC's recommended daily activity levels. Needless to say, these are much higher than city averages. 84% of participants row for free, and 53% come from families with a household income under $30,000. Over half will become first generation college students.

Description

::sticky::
Details

Made by hand in the Marche region of Italy

title: corduroy dad hat (Drone Cap - Navy)
description:
Navy Blue corduroy dad hat with satin-stitched drone bee motif. 20% of the proceeds will be donated to the Honeybee Conservancy. Read more below.
At Rowing Blazers, the bee has been an important part of our brand since the beginning. We've made hats and ties with a carefully embroidered bee motif, and many of our blazers feature brass buttons adorned with bee and bee-hive motifs. Our double-breasted blazer is emblazoned with Latin proverb "Ubi mel ibi apes": "Where there is honey, there are bees." But bee populations are dying at an alarming rate. And these tiny creatures play a gigantic role in our creating and maintaining our food supply, the stability of our ecosystem, and biodiversity. So we've decided to partner with the Honeybee Conservancy, a non-profit established in response to the bee crisis. The Honeybee Conservancy engages in education and outreach; and supports bee research and builds bee habitats, while increasing access to organic, sustainable food in under-served communities. And for this week - and for the next month - we are donating 20% of our proceeds from all four of our bee hats and our bee tie to the Honeybee Conservancy. Help us help the Honeybees, and visit thehoneybeeconservancy.org to learn more about what you can do for these magnificent little creatures.
Adjustable. One size fits most.

description:
This double breasted overcoat is our favorite piece of outerwear when the temperature drops. It is a throwback to early Polo coats given its wide lapels, generously overlapping button stance, turnback cuffs, and martingala belted back. Our version is a modern update on the classic with modern fit, softer shoulders, half-lined interior, and a length that hits just above the knee. This versatile navy overcoat will have you looking stylish for many winters to come. 
 
This overcoat is made up in the coating version of our signature 'Balloon' wool cloth. As with the 'Balloon' cloth used in our jackets, it has natural stretch for a comfortable fit along with wrinkle-resistance, allowing the overcoat to retain its shape. 
Model TAC-01 is cut true to size with elegant detailing. We recommend taking your normal size for a modern fit, or one size up for a more classic look.

title: Super Heavyweight Rugby by Sports D'Epoque (The Croquet Rugby)
description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) rugby jersey with our signature vertical croquet stripes. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; three-button placket.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
Before Rowing Blazers launched, we wanted to design an eye-catching stripe that recalls the wild "deck-chair" stripes of club blazers often seen (even today) at Henley Royal Regatta, Cambridge, and Oxford. Armed only with Microsoft Paint, and using the stripes of a vintage croquet wicket for inspiration, co-founder and former national champion oarswoman Keziah Beall designed what would become the brand's signature stripe. Rowing Blazers has made jackets for both men and women in the house Croquet Stripe since day 1, and they've graced the backs of celebrities from actor Will Ferrell to Olympic gold medalist Kerri Walsh, menswear icon Poggy "the Man", and Lance Thomas of the New York Knicks. The same stripe was used in an instantly sold-out shorts collaboration with Eric Emanuel this summer, a performance singlet collaboration with Tracksmith this fall, and a signet ring created with Jessica Biales this winter. Now, for the first time, we are launching one of our main categories - the rugby shirt - in our signature croquet stripe.

title: Busted-seam button-down shirt (White Distressed Oxford with Busted Seams)
description:
The perfect Oxford shirt with reverse ("busted") seams. Handmade and distressed in the U.S.A. 100% Japanese cotton Oxford cloth. Hand distressed collar and cuffs.
Enzyme washed for softness. Soft S-roll button down collar. Pure cotton buttons. American placket. Rowing Blazers sandpaper card included for additional at-home distressing. (Props not included.)
This shirt has a modern cut. Model is 5'11" and wears a Medium.
"I had an Oxford cloth button-down shirt that I practically lived in. I wore it while excavating in Italy; hiking in Patagonia; celebrating at Henley after exhilarating victories; drowning my sorrows at Henley after gutting losses; I wore it to elegant dinners and to many more greasy spoons. The collar and cuffs wore down and frayed with years of use, and seams started to come apart. And it just felt right. We've recreated that feeling -- without overdoing it, but also without kidding ourselves, with just the right amount of tongue-in-cheek. That's why we include a piece of sandpaper with each shirt, printed on the reverse with a withering quote by the great Edward Said about his Princeton roommates who used to sand the collars of their BDs." - Jack

title: Row New York Blazer (Manhattan Blazer - Noah x Rowing Blazers)
description:
Part of a limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Noah, in support of Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. The program serves over 4000 kids from all five boroughs, mostly from the city's under-resourced communities. Striped blazer with Manhattan embroidery on the chest pocket. Hand-tailored in New York City. Year-round wool-cotton; 3-roll-2 silhouette.
Rowing Blazers house button in brass. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Hidden-stitch patch pockets.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-44 run regular.
15% of all sales will go directly to Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. Both Rowing Blazers and Noah are NYC-based brands, and it means a lot to both to be able to partner with a program that has a direct impact on the community in which they create. 100% of kids at Row New York graduate high school and 99% go on to college; 100% exceed the CDC's recommended daily activity levels. Needless to say, these are much higher than city averages. 84% of participants row for free, and 53% come from families with a household income under $30,000. Over half will become first generation college students.

title: Wide-wale Corde-du-Roi Trousers (Dusty Rose Corduroy Trousers)
description:
100% cotton corduroy pants in Dusty Rose. Hand-tailored in New York.
Old school mid-rise. Hand-tailored trousers in extra soft, wide-wale Italian corduroy.
These pants are straight leg - our slightly more fitted cut. Pants are listed by waist size. Waist sizes 28-32 are 32 inches in length. Larger waist sizes are 34 inches in length. Roll 'em up or get 'em trimmed if needed!
"Corde-du-roi" ("cord of the king") is the mythical origin for the modern word "corduroy." In reality, the material originated as an industrial workwear fabric. We prefer the more regal connotation. And that's why, while most corduroy trousers - even the expensive ones - feel stiff and starchy, ours are super soft. Made from luxurious Italian wide-wale corduroy, our trousers are velvet-y enough to nap in. Hand-tailored in New York City and perfect for September-March.

title: Super Heavyweight Rugby by Sports D'Epoque (England 1871 authentic heavyweight rugby)
description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) white rugby jersey with embroidered rose. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Wing collar and five-button placket.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
In December 1870, five Scottish football clubs invited English footballers to participate in a match played using “Rugby Rules”. The challenge was ignored by the England Football Association but Blackheath, one of London's oldest football clubs, accepted and fielded England's first international rugby side. On Monday 27th March 1871, some 4,000 spectators descended on Edinburgh’s Raeburn Place to watch the match. Played over two fifty-minute halves, there were no penalty goals in this inaugural match, as it was understood that gentlemen would not cheat. These men, playing in white jerseys with an oversized rose emblem and wing collar, became the first to wear the now-famous red rose of England.

title: 100% Pima Cotton Polo (Authentic Polo Shirt with Satin Stripe - Light Blue)
description:
100% pima cotton real piqué polo jersey with a genuine, hand-sewn diagonal satin stripe. Authentic, but also modern and uncomplicated.
Three-button placket (the good ol' fashioned way). Split tail. No logo on chest, because, come on, you either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing. 100% Peruvian pima cotton. Props not included.
Unisex (men's sizing). Classic / oversized fit. For a more fitted look, order one size down.
"This shirt is based on a vintage Yale polo jersey from the early 80s: it was beautiful. Navy blue soft pima cotton (no tech-y fabrics) with a hand-stitched white satin stripe - not too wide - running diagonally across the front. No one makes polo shirts like these (until now), and there's a reason why: it's not easy, because the pima cotton is a knit, and the satin is a woven. It has to be sewn by hand. But it's worthwhile, because the result is just right. I would never buy a pieced piqué diagonal stripe polo shirt; but this is a different animal altogether. You feel like Laddie Sanford, or like Steve McQueen in the Thomas Crown Affair. But it's also modern and uncomplicated. Our polos don't have any logo on the chest, because I like it that way; I either want the logo of some weird old club, or nothing." - Jack
