description: The Seiko “Pogue” chronograph is one of the most interesting and distinctive watches from the 1970s. They have earned the nickname the “Pogue” since Colonel William R. Pogue wore a similar watch during a NASA Skylab mission in 1973, making it the first automatic chronograph to be worn is space. These are wonderful watches on the wrist and very easy to wear. This watch is currently on view at the Rowing Blazers Clubhouse at 161 Grand Street in New York City. Curated by Wind Vintage. Ships separately. Please allow an additional 7-10 days for delivery. title: Super Heavyweight Rugby by Sports D'Epoque (England 1910 authentic heavyweight rugby)
description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) white rugby jersey with an embroidered rose patch in the style of the jerseys worn by the England team at world's first Five Nations rugby tournament in 1910. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; three-button placket; gorgeous rib knit cuffs.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
January 1st, 1910, marked the first day of the world's first Five Nations rugby tournament. This version of the English rose, elaborately embroidered on a square patch and then applied to the heavyweight jersey, was introduced during this tournament. Our unique four-button placket is also period-correct to 1910.

title: Super Heavyweight Rugby by Sports D'Epoque (Ireland 1895 authentic heavyweight rugby)
description:
Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) mossy green rugby jersey with oversized five-sprig Shamrock emblem. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Off-center rugby collar (true to the original); three-button placket; gorgeous rib knit cuffs.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
Ireland Rugby had difficult beginnings, having to wait five years after its first match to score a point. But things have been better since Ireland Rugby's first test victory against Scotland in 1881, around which time the team adopted its green jersey with an oversized embroidered clover sprig running up most of the jersey's left side and an off-center collar.

These include the naked swim out to the victorious crew; the traditional blazer-fights; and the post-race kroegjool festivities. This year marks the 135th Varsity. title: Distressed cotton blazer (Destroyed "X" Blazer in Burgundy Cotton Twill)
description:
The destroyed version of our cotton twill blazer, in the style of the jackets worn at the annual Dutch Varsity regatta. This jacket features raw edges at the lapel notch and around the chest pocket, and it is enzyme washed to make it extra soft. It's also machine-washable.
Hand tailored in New York. 3-roll-2 silhouette. 100% cotton. Three patch pockets. Handmade cloisonné buttonhole badge included. Unlined back. Self-lined fronts. Single button cuffs. Ventless. Machine washable. Cross-stitched Latin proverb ("O Tempora! O Mores!") under lapel. Props not included.
This jacket has a modern cut. 36 runs short; 38-40 run regular. 42-46 available regular or long. Model is 6'0" and wears a 40.
We took our signature blazer fit and construction and rendered it in a rugged burgundy cotton twill, in the style of the cotton jackets worn at the annual Dutch Varsity regatta - where student rowers famously engage in semi-organized fights, grabbing each other by the lapels and trying to wrestle each other to the ground. Then we subtly destroyed it with raw edges on the lapel notches and around the edge of the chest pocket, and enzyme washed it to give it a soft, lived-in feel. Machine washable.

title: Super Heavyweight Rugby by Sports D'Epoque (South Africa 1906 authentic heavyweight rugby)
description:
This rugby in size XXXL is currently available for PREORDER and will ship in 1-2 weeks. Super heavyweight (400g / 14 oz.) dark green rugby jersey with deep yellow "gold" collar and embroidered springbok shield. Handmade in Europe. 100% cotton, knitted in the traditional 12 gauge style. Stunning material and craftsmanship. Feels incredible.
Rugby collar; three-button placket; gorgeous rib knit cuffs.
This rugby has a traditional fit. For a relaxed fit, order one size up.
This is a replica of South Africa's 1906-1907 tour jersey, the one that earned them the nickname, the Springboks. In 1994, in the spirit of change and new beginnings, the African National Congress government voted to replace the springbok as the nation’s sporting emblem with the king protea flower. But President Nelson Mandela famously intervened to allow the rugby team to retain its springbok badge. The very next year, newly democratic South Africa hosted the rugby World Cup. In one of the nation's greatest sporting moments, South Africa won, and Mandela, dressed in a Springboks jersey, presented the trophy to team captain Francois Pienaar.

title: Row New York Rugby Shirt (The Bronx Rugby Shirt - Noah x Rowing Blazers)
description:
Part of a limited edition collaboration between Rowing Blazers and Noah, in support of Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. The program serves over 4000 kids from all five boroughs, mostly from the city's under-resourced communities. Vertical stripe rugby shirt with oversized The Bronx embroidery on the back. 100% cotton.
Rugby collar. R.B. logo beneath placket; Noah logo on left cuff; large satin-stitched borough embroidery on back. Made in Canada.
This rugby runs trim. We recommend ordering one size up. Unisex.
15% of all sales will go directly to Row New York - an NYC non-profit and after-school rowing and academic program for middle and high-school students, regardless of their background or ability. Both Rowing Blazers and Noah are NYC-based brands, and it means a lot to both to be able to partner with a program that has a direct impact on the community in which they create. 100% of kids at Row New York graduate high school and 99% go on to college; 100% exceed the CDC's recommended daily activity levels. Needless to say, these are much higher than city averages. 84% of participants row for free, and 53% come from families with a household income under $30,000. Over half will become first generation college students

The popover hoodie is our go-to for post workouts or weekend coffee runs, crafted from softly structured fleece in a family-owned factory in Toronto. All Todd Snyder + Champion premium knitwear is exclusively designed, manufactured and distributed by Todd Snyder.

description: This multitasking essential is crafted from lightweight rinsed denim that’s destined to break in gently over time, for that perfect well-worn texture. Inspired by a vintage workwear classic, and tailored for modern versatility.

title: Gavia Marsala
description:
The unmistakable Gavia — a low-top with high-top sensibilities. Crafted with the highest quality pebble-grain leather, the Gavia features metal mountaineering eyelets and a slightly raised heel tab. The Gavia in burgundy is perfect for all four seasons.

Made by hand in the Marche region of Italy
Constructed with finely-cut calfskin leather, sourced straight from Italy
Lined with buttery-soft calf leather
Features painted matte mountaineering eyelets
Outfitted with durable, lightweight rubber outsoles by our friends at Margom
Finished with hand-painted edges

title: Japanese Wool Necktie (Bath Club Tie)
description:
Handmade in New York. 100% Japanese wool. Single embroidered faucet motif.
"Tipsy" Latin address label on back. (Props not included).
One size. 2 7/8 inches wide.
"The oldest pub in Oxford is The Bear Inn, a thirteenth-century institution where the walls and ceiling are covered in swatches of club, academic and regimental neckties. If you go into The Bear wearing a club tie that doesn't already grace their establishment, you may have a piece snipped off with scissors in return for a half-pint of beer and a small card to complete with the club name, date and your signature. I noticed a swatch embroidered with a single yellow faucet and a card inscribed ‘O.U. Bath Club.’ Curious, I googled ‘Oxford University Bath Club:’ no results. So I undertook more formal research, to find that the Oxford University Bath Club (with sister institutions as near as Cambridge and as far as Auckland University in New Zealand) existed until the 1950s or so. It was not a formal club, as such, but rather a tie that was worn by those who had ‘bathed’ in one of the women’s colleges. The combination of irreverence, history and discovery embodied in the Bath Club tie is a perfect reflection of Rowing Blazers’ spirit." - Jack

title: 100% Lambswool Sweater (Harry's New York Bar Sweater)
description:
100% lambswool golf sweater emblazoned with Harry's famous bar flies motif. Made in Great Britain. Props not included.
100% lambswool. Made in Great Britain. Props not included.
Unisex. Runs true to size (men's sizes).
Harry's is a legendary institution that made its mark in the worlds of literature, music, art, politics - and of course drinking. Established in 1911, Harry's New York Bar is the birthplace of the Bloody Mary, the Side Car, the French 75, and a long list of other iconic cocktails. The bar itself - decorated with wood panelling, foreign banknotes, the shields of Oxford and Cambridge colleges, and, most notably, vintage American collegiate banners and felt pennants - was a favorite watering hole for the likes of Jean-Paul Sartre, Ernest Hemingway, Rita Hayworth, Jack Dempsey, the Duke of Windsor, Thornton Wilder, Marlene Dietrich, Humphrey Bogart, and Coco Chanel. The Piano Room downstairs was frequented by Gershwin, who composed "An American in Paris" there. Harry's New York Bar continues to be a gathering place for intellectuals, celebrities, sportsmen and rakes. Many have been inducted into Harry's very own secret society, the International Bar Flies (or I.B.F.), whose icon - two cartoon flies - adorn the mirror behind the bar. To this day, Harry's is known for its limited menu: a wide variety of the best cocktails in Paris, and to eat... only hot dogs.
